Reviews.Title: “best choice for san fran stay”
Reviews.Author: wearethebryants
Reviews.Content: couldn't fault this place. great location, on the embarcadero sea front, great views of the Bay bridge, opposite the ferry building, 5 min walk from the shops at Union Square. Personally found this a much better option than staying in the overly touristy area of fisherman's wharf. If you need to go there, the tram takes about 5 mins and costs $2. very comfortable rooms and excellent breakfast. Didn't try the restaurant in the evenings as there are so many choices available nearby. will return to san fran soon hopefully, and will head straight back to this place

Reviews.Title: “Modern atmosphere with great views”
Reviews.Author: Nanc8
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel that is very comfortable, & close to all parts of the San Francisco area. Walk across the street to the market & try all kinds of fresh fish & veggies, plus chocolates to die for.The view of the bridge & water from our room was relaxing.They have a great restaurant on site, & many more in walking distance. Stroll to the museums or take a taxi to Fisherman,s Wharf for sightseeing.Go on a tour of Alcatraz & see the sea lions.Book a ticket online before you go to avoid long lines & sell outs. We will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: patricia p
Reviews.Content: As a visitor to San Fransisco I relied on the hotel staff and they did not dissapoint. Always helpful with arrangements. Stayed here because of the location and it was wonderful,near the ferry terminal but loved the yoga and all the other amenities offered.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay at the hotel vitale”
Reviews.Author: thinkingmore
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed 5 nights in the hotel vitale. perfect suite (panorama suite), perfect service. the most beautiful suite i've ever been with a wonderful view. just around there are some excellent restauraunts.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectation!”
Reviews.Author: RawFitness
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed in the embarkadero area, but loved it. Our room had a very of the bay bridge and the water. The area is not as heck it as union square. The outdoor seating areas on the 5th and 7th floors had fantastic views. I love heavenly beds and free wifi in the room. Besides free tea and coffee in the lobby, the hotel provided a free car service( mercedes hybrid) to union square, even though it is a short ten minute walk. Also we had a large mirror in our room that had a reflection of that fanastic view, I did not want to leave the room!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, great nightlife!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin T
Reviews.Content: I often stay at the Vitale when I'm in San Francisco on business. The property is very nice, clean, modern, and with a great nightlife. You have the option of overlooking the water, bridge or the city. The only downfall might be the noise, but since you're in a vibrant city it shouldn't be unexpected. The Americano bar is ALWAYS busy, and is always great for people watching or meeting new friends. It's noisy, so it's not the best place for conversations or business meetings. The restaurant section offers good food and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Best suite I have ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline H
Reviews.Content: It was my husband's birthday weekend. The Vitale exceeded expectations on every level. The suite had a 180 degree view of the Bay, the products were from Fresh and smelt divine, it was extremely spacious, the staff made you feel like you were at home. The location is also killer. The ferry building and Saturday farmers market are mere footsteps away. I cannot say enough about this hotel. Try it for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Vital”
Reviews.Author: bwalya
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel....great on all points - location, decor, facilities...my kinda hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier with Hotel Vitale”
Reviews.Author: Alejandrabc
Reviews.Content: New, modern hotel on the Embarcadero, in front of the Ferry building. I got a corner room, beautifully decorated, comfortable and spacious. The bathroom was huge, with an awesome bathtub (that was like a swimming pool) and a separated shower. Every afternoon they leave you chocolates, the weather forecast for tomorrow and a piece of paper with nice quotes! Great detail. Also, if you agree, they leave you the San Francisco Chronicle every morning, hanging from your door nob in a nice little bag. The staff was amazing, especially Monique, the concierge, very helpful. Breakfast was delicious (only menu, no buffet) and even though I didn't have dinner or drinks at the restaurant, it was always full of people and seemed like they were having a good time. Location was amazing, at the beginning of Mission St, right next to Market St and the ferry building. Bus 14 and Cable car F stops on the same corner of the hotel, MUNI station a block away, and a 10 minute walk to Union Square. The neighborhood is clean, with beautiful views of the Bay Bridge, has a good nightlife atmosphere and many places to eat and drink since it's very close to offices. I know it might be a little more expensive than other hotels I considered booking in SF, but for me, it was worth every penny. I recommend it without hesitating. Ps: finally took some photos of the room!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: jeanette5ofus
Reviews.Content: A beautiful location, beautiful room and wonderful staff. The terraces with views of the Bay Bridge are worth the price alone. We were give a large carafe of coffee, free of charge from the restaurant to enjoy on the terrace along with a complementary San Francisco Chronicle. If you enjoy spa treatments, the eighth floor is dedicated to quiet relaxing treatments.We travel to the city often, and this is our favorite hotel yet!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: dubupak
Reviews.Content: Reasons I loved it: rooftop deck, great location (a great Saturday market across the street at the ferry terminal), great views, clean, comfortable - unpretentious decor/ambience, great service (they threw away the old drinks in our car) Lather bath products! The only negative was the price of valet - almost $50!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Richard P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Vitale for two nights back in September and found the hotel to be first rate. Firstly it's not cheap and if you want a room with a view then be prepared to pay even more. However it's location is fantastic and you can sit across from the Embarcadero whilst enjoying a few drinks in the hotel bar. The room we stayed in was an urban studio which came with a separate shower and bath - great being able to have a bath whilst looking out to the bay. The only thing to be wary of is the rather expensive valet service - $45 a night is not cheap in my mind.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - slightly pricey”
Reviews.Author: NT1001
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night on our way to the east coast and we were grateful that our room was available when we arrived at 11am given we had been travelling for 15 hours. The room was on the 7th floor and it had a great view of the bay. When I booked, I asked for an upgrade to a higher floor which costs $100. I`m not sure that the extra money is worth it as it`s the only time we`ve stayed here and not sure what the rooms are like on the lower floors. We usually stay at the Fairmont Ghirardelli Square which has similar prices but only takes bookings for 3 nights or more. The location of Hotel Vitale is ok but again, it depends what you`re wanting to see and do. There are a few restaurants close by but we chose to eat at the Americano in the hotel. The pizzas were good and the service was ok. Would we return? Possibly, if the price was better.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: carpetdave
Reviews.Content: The Vitale was without doubt one of my best hotel experiences From the 7 series pick up at the airport though the lovely welcome A nice bottle of fizz waiting In the beautifully decorated room (and we stayed in The standard room type ) through the speedy confirmation of our table at Commonwealth Restaurant on Mission and within 2 hours of arriving we were sitting at our table Enjoying fantastic food at one of the city's best restaurants The hotel just got better every day great location By the ferry terminal 3 mins walk to the slanted door restaurant And blue bottle coffee 15 mins walk to Barneys 15 seconds across the road to the famous boulevard restaurant And the Americano restaurant in the hotel has great food and the bar is buzzing I would be amazed if any reasonable person did not love this place

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is SPECTACULAR!”
Reviews.Author: dwuschke
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling a lot for work and started staying at the Vitale a few trips ago.. and this hotel gets better and better with each visit. The staff is friendly, helpful and makes me feel like a VIP everytime I am there. I signed up for their loyalty program and was put in a gorgeous room with amazing views of the bay and the Ferry building and roof deck access. Rooms are clean, spacious and the bathrooms are excellent and fully stocked with Fresh products. Also -- and really important to note-- the staff went above and beyond for me! In my haste to check out and catch a flight, I left a ring (family heirloom) on the bedside table and checked out. When I realized it was there, I called the front desk and they immediately went up to the room and found it! When they returned my call, they offered to hold it or ship it back to me immediately..... when I got back to the office that Monday it was on my desk. Talk about AMAZING customer service. I will continue to stay at Hotel Vitale for ALL of my trips to SF!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, clean rooms, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: cityNeil
Reviews.Content: The Good: Knowledgeable and helpful front desk staff. Rooms were tastefully done, not huge but really nice. The hotel is quiet, the bar was excellent and food good. The position is very good. The not so good: We had a deluxe, ocean-view room, but there was no bath. Not a big deal but for the money would've expected a bath as well as a shower. For a room advertising an ocean view, it was not that great. The room was on a busy road and was a bit noisy at night. Still, this was a classy hotel with first class service, and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “delightful service”
Reviews.Author: Belinda017
Reviews.Content: I returned to Hotel Vitale this year for the Yoga Journal Conference, January 12th-16th. Although I had the least expensive king room, I was on the seventh floor with a lovely outlook towards the Embarcadero. Some of the interior courtyard rooms on the lower levels do not have such a nice view - be forewarned, you might choose to upgrade if you book an inexpensive room and do not like the view. That said, the service in this hotel is always discrete and exemplary. They make it look easy. From front desk to housekeeping, I felt pampered in an unobtrusive way that is fast becoming nonexistent in most hotels. I do not like the pretentious atmosphere of some upscale SF hotels. Vitale is sophisticated without being stuffy. The location is cleaner and safer than hotels around Union Square or Nob Hill and if you are a coffee drinker, make the pilgrimage to Blue Bottle in the Embarcadero - you won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “A stunning boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: GCPurple
Reviews.Content: Great location across from the Ferry Building and easy access to public transport down to fishermans wharf & an easy 10 min walk to union square. Would recommend staying in a room with water views which we had and views of the bay bridge which is stunning at night. We had great service at the front desk & conceirge. Beautiful bathrooms with gorgeous toiliteries, we stayed a sunday and monday night over a long weekend. A great business centre where you can use computers to check emails etc.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: wlb23
Reviews.Content: Although we have a home in northern California and an apartment in San Francisco, as a special treat for my wife's birthday we reserved an overnight stay at Hotel Vitale on December 2, 2011. The hotel is in a wonderful location on the Embarcardero and across the street from the Ferry Building and all its shops and farmer's market. After check in, at about 4:15, we proceeded to the bar and lounge for a cocktail and a snack. The room was so crowded we at first could not find a table. When finally seated the noise was so loud and the crush of people so uncomfortable, with people leaning on our table, taking chairs from our table, and generally being unruly, that we had to leave before we even finished what we had ordered. After a long walk on the Embarcadero we returned at about 8:30 to find that the crowd was larger and louder, and a band or DJ had been added to the noise. Unable to enter the lounge we looked for a comfortable place in the lobby, but people had spilled out onto the lobby couches also. The noise in the lobby was as unbearable as it had been earlier in the lounge. I spoke with the front desk about the lack of a place to relax and sit down and it was laughed off with "It's Friday night and we are always crowded"! On return to our room we continued to be "serenaded" by the DJ for the next couple hours. If the hotel is going to serve as a "twenty-something" pick-up bar I would suggest it advise guests before their arrival and also designate a private lounge for use by hotel guests. I travel considerably on business, and my wife and I travel much for pleasure. I am a member of the Club of Small Luxury Hotels and the Fairmont President's Club, and regularly stay at high end hotels. I can honestly say that at the present time I have no reason to stay at the Hotel Vitale hotel again or to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, modern wharf front property”
Reviews.Author: Marigator
Reviews.Content: We hosted a business function here and had the pleasure of staying in one of their round upstairs suites for a few days. The room was nicely appointed with every luxury and walls of windows ensure a spectacular view from every side. The bed was comfortable with lots of pillows and luxurious bedding and centrally located in the suite to maximize the view of the sunrise over the bridge in the morning. We also really enjoyed the large stand alone tub for two That looks out over the bridge and water. On the business end they provided a large meeting room and several very nice meals for the attendants. Very friendly, accommidating staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was pleasant in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: mcb9
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel that has it all - plush rooms that won't break the bank, fantastic location and a wonderful staff. It's situated near the water, right across the street from the Embarcadero so many of the rooms have wonderful water views. There's also a great rooftop, a perfect vantage point to see the beautiful city. There's a bike rental place around the corner and I went for bike rides to the Golden Gate bridge every morning I stayed there. Right nearby is a great crafts/arts marketplace, a little bit touristic but still had some cool stuff. The hotel has a spa too (I had wanted to try one of the treatment with rooftop soaking tubs, but it didn't work out with our schedule). There are tons of great restaurants within walking distance, including Boulevard, right across the street. The concierge desk is especially helpful and kind with great ideas on walking tours, shopping and restaurants to fit your specific need. This is a great bet, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value by the Ferry building”
Reviews.Author: TheTub
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vitale last April for four days. Meant to write a review sooner but never got around to it until now. The hotel, the flagship property of the Joie de Vivre group (an overly cheerful name for a hotel chain, I must confess), is located reasonably centrally, by the Ferry building. Although the views from some of the rooms are rather nice, I wasnâ€™t crazy about the location. Aside from the Ferry building (which houses a large market â€“ mostly, though not exclusively, food related), there didnâ€™t seem to be much of interest on the Embarcadero for quite a while. Also, although very close to Market Street (one of San Franciscoâ€™s main thoroughfares), you have to walk for a good 15 minutes before you get to the shopping area. In my view, both the Four Seasons and the St. Regis, located further down Market Street are better situated. As to the Vitale itself, although designed in a subtle and elegant style, it is starting to show signs of wear. This was evident in both some of the communal areas and the rooms. The Amarericano Bar, in particular, was in dire need of a revamp, with many of its leather lounge chairs sporting unsightly tears. Also, some of the furniture in both rooms we had booked was stained and the carpet had started to fluff visibly. Only ate in-house for breakfast, which was perfectly nice throughout our stay, with a good selection a la carte (no buffet). Also, when the weather allowed it, Americano would host an al fresco aperitif which, although we never managed to attend, seemed quite pleasant. I should also mention that there are two Michelin starred restaurant within a block of the hotel: Boulevard and One Market (I can recommend the latter for the food, which really was rather good and of decent value; as to the atmosphere, the place is so large and busy, and the service so swift, it feels like being in a highly sophisticated fast-food joint). Service was good throughout, though not memorable. To be fair to the hotel, our stay wasnâ€™t very expensive, with an average nightly rate of slightly less than $300 (for Deluxe Waterfront rooms), hence the relatively generous rating. However, if I were to return to San Francisco, I would probably upgrade to a better property. The recently opened St. Regis, in particular, seemed rather impressive; the Four Seasons and Ritz-Carlton decidedly less so - both seemed in need of a make-over too.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: JimnKrisM0m
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the Wharf, across from the Ferry Marketplace. Right next to the hotel antique streetcars go from Union Square down the whole length of the Wharf from Pier 1 to Pier 43. The hotel staff are delightful, and will get you practically whatever you want. We asked for a table in our room to play cards, and had it for our entire stay. The food was exceptional, as was the wait staff. It's not a cheap hotel, but it was worth the money. We had a view of the bay, and of the San Francisco Bay Bridge. the BART station was within 2 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ucddoc
Reviews.Content: We were there the weekend of the wedding where several attendees gave a rather negative review. We were not part of that and had a very different experience. The hotel is well located with the Ferry building being such a great place to stroll. We booked a delux water view and the view was spectacular. The room was small but adequate. Drawer space limited. The concierge was the absolue best in booking our dinner reservations and a suggestion for a dim sum lunch hidden in the Rincon building across the street (which was great!). The valet service is slow as the cars are parkedna distance from the hotel. The bar gets crowded and noisy but the cocktails are good. We enjoyed our stay an have already booked a return visit. We have stayed at many hotels in SF and other than places like the Four Seasons or Mandarin Oriental, where you pay by mortgaging your house, this is our go to place.

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: JPR2003
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here before flying out to Portland. After spending a very disappointing night at a Kimpton property I booked this based on other reviews. We had a water view room. It was beautiful. Upon telling the desk clerk of our anniversary we were sent a bottle of wine. A nice touch. Location to the Ferry Building and restaurants was perfect compared to our creepy stay at the wharf Kimpton. The staff was great. We will definitely seek out other Joie de Vivre properties in our future travels.

Reviews.Title: “One thing after another....”
Reviews.Author: JoshATAK
Reviews.Content: What a horrible experience. Stayed at the Vitale Hotel last weekend for a good friendâ€™s wedding. With the group discount, the basic room was $219/night (not including taxes, etc.). The valet parking was $48/night. I donâ€™t mind paying for a hotel room in an expensive city, but this hotel is managed as a cheap motel. Upon arrival, after leaving the car with the valet, there was no bellhop to assist with the luggage so we carried it ourselves. I can handle that. However, a few hours later we called the concierge for a large taxi as the majority of taxis can only carry four people. The front desk agreed to call our taxi for the rehearsal dinner, but upon arriving downstairs, learned that a taxi had never been called and no one really cared that we had been misled. We ended up being late to our event and had to take 2 taxi's.... The ceremony was held off site, but the reception was on site. It was in an outdoor patio that had been closed in for the winter and only provided minimal heaters. It was freezing and the majority of women kept their winter jackets on all night. Later the wait staff, while bringing out the hors dâ€™oeuvres, managed to spill an entire tray of soup (held in tall shot glasses), with the majority spilling on my fiancÃ©â€™s dress. No apologies. The next day upon check out, again there was no service to assist with the luggage. Then the valet did not pull the car into the hotel driveway/entrance, although there was plenty of room. The valet parked it on the street, and we carried our luggage to the car, only to find the valet using super glue on the car key. They did not come up and apologize for breaking the key, instead they were trying to repair it and not tell us. It seemed to be a freak accident, but the valet managed to break a key (one with the electronic system). Not sure how it happened, but super glue does not seem to be the best fix. In the end, we finally told a manager, who apologized but did not seem to be overly concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been nice ...”
Reviews.Author: bkatie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vitale last night. We had four rooms. One for me and husband, one for our 21 year old son, one for my sister, and one for my parents who required a handicap accessible room. We had originally planned to stay at the Mark Hopkins and made reservations there for the four rooms. The Mark Hopkins offered a large, almost 700 square foot room, handicap accessible room with two walls of views of the Bay. The other three rooms were view rooms but not as grand as the accessible room. The total price, believe it or not, for the four rooms at the Mark Hopkins was less than the price for four rooms at Vitale, but my parents opted for the Vitale because of its proximity to the Ferry Building and the Bay Bridge. My parents wanted a "view" room so they could spend the afternoon in their room enjoying the splendid views before our evening engagement in San Francisco. We checked in a bit before 3:00. All of the rooms but the accessible room were ready to be occupied. My parents agreed to sit with us in our room until theirs was ready, which the woman at the front desk told us would be "in about 15 minutes". Just before 4:00 I went to my parents room and found housekeeping still working. At that time we were told it would be a minimum of a half hour before the room was ready. Let's remember that check-in is at 3:00. Since it is dark by about 5:00, my parent's plan of enjoying their "view" room was not to be. We went to dinner and returned to the Vitale to have a car drive us to our evening engagement. While waiting for the car to arrive, I pushed my mother in her wheelchair to the Vitale lobby restroom. We had an unfortunately terrible experience in the restroom related to patrons of the Americano restaurant in the Vitale lobby. This story is already MUCH too long. I am not usually one to point out short comings of an establishment, but the treatment we received at the Vitale is the worst we have received anywhere at anytime. The hotel was quite attractive, and the rooms were well equipped and pleasant enough, but the service and attention were exceptionally poor. I believe the hotel should have offered my parents a discount or perhaps even a refund of the cost of their room given the unfortunate set of circumstances. The rooms were VERY quiet for hotel rooms in San Francisco which was a pleasant surprise, and the breakfast we had this morning at the Americano was quite good. We should have kept our reservations at the Mark Hopkins.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: arnofio
Reviews.Content: We found the rooms and hotel very contemporary yet relaxing - the sound system in the room was particularly good. Luxury hotel, although when we took a walk just around the block it felt quite threatening. This could be a SF thing, the number of homeless people in the city was shockingly high and this contributed to the sense of being unsafe just a short walk away. A real shame because we loved the city and the hotel (except for the unexpected $40 day parking charge)

Reviews.Title: “Understated luxury”
Reviews.Author: Parsky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the center of holiday parties for the uber-cool, but everyone is welcome and made to feel special at this five star primo property. I decided to bring my young son along with me on a business trip, and the staff made us both feel super welcome. The Ferry building is only steps away as are the city's other great attractions. Make sure to ask for the hotel's signature tote bags before venturing to the must see Sunday Farmer's Market. If you enjoy quiet luxury that doesnt need to try too hard, this is your spot. For me, this vibe very much represents what I love about the city itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: DCbella85
Reviews.Content: Luxury hotel in a great location right by the Embarcadero. Very close to shopping, dining, and transportation. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “With so many choices in SF, there has to be a better choice!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravel206
Reviews.Content: Rude parking attendant --- quoted an incorrect flat rate and then the parking attendant later that night made us pay $48 instead of $30 quoted by the first parking attendant. Probably thought we were attending a wedding at the hotel or something, but the attendant never clarified that. Also, rooms are TINY! Spa is nice. Great massage and service is friendly. Best thing is the server at breakfast. Getting ice requires a bellman -- a little inconvienent. Location is across from the revamped Ferry Building chuck full of food vendors...a fun jaunt. Occupy SF is camped outside and is stinky. Very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very stylish”
Reviews.Author: 2VAGuys
Reviews.Content: I finally stayed at Hotel Vitale and loved every minute of it. They upgraded me to a bi-level room which was enormous - and with an equally enormous terrace. The view was the Ferry Building and the Bay - perfect. If you love great style and you appreciate how very special it is being near the Ferry Building, you will love this place. I like being near the Ferry Building for the food aspects - and particularly when there is a farmer's market (best on Saturday morning).

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business or Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Pay_It_Forward
Reviews.Content: If you are searching for a hotel that is close to many attractions in San Francisco, you cannot go wrong with Hotel Vitale. The location is the best feature of this property. Ferry Building is right across the street from the hotel. Fisherman's Wharf is about 10 minutes away by tram. AT&T Park and Union Square are also within walking distance. The hotel staff deserves to be highlighted too. They helped us with restaurant suggestions, directions and transportations. If we needed anything, they were there to help. Sometimes it is difficult to hail a taxi at the hotel, so leave yourself some extra time if you need to take a taxi from the hotel. Make sure you check out the roof-top terraces. The Embarcadero looks stunning from up high!

Reviews.Title: “a perfect week”
Reviews.Author: jgnh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vitale during Thanksgiving week and it was just about perfect. The staff was wonderful from the concierge to the doormen. It is a great location across from the Ferry building where you can have breakfast a different great place every day. The ferry to Sausilito is there too. The view is spectacular and you don't have to be on high floor I was on 3 and I loved it. And my window did open, not a lot, but enough to get fresh air. And if you can, get a massage at the spa it was one of the best I have ever had. The linens and bath products are great and the bed was excellent. It is only two blocks from the BART and the MUNI and cable cars stop right in front, so it is easy to get anywhere. Don't miss the Farmer's Market at the Ferry building on Saturday, it's wonderful. Also this is a pet friendly hotel, I didn't bring my dog, but my kids could bring theirs in which was very convenient. The view from the roof deck is spectacular. This is my hotel in SF from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Alaskatravel1234
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Vitale is a nice hotel in an excellent location. The rooms are spacious and the staff was friendly. We loved the shampoos and soaps by "Fresh." There were a couple of things that could be improved. The carpet in our room was badly stained and should have been replaced. The valet parking was slow. Even though we always called requesting our car several minutes before leaving our room, we stood outside waiting, sometimes as long as 15 minutes, for the valet to bring the car around.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Georges-P-Stephan
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, with a lovely and always smilling personnel, all garnished by an Excellent restaurant (Americano).

Reviews.Title: “Stylish break”
Reviews.Author: Susan503
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in Hotel Vitale in November 2011 staying in a Bay view (water view) room. The room was large and had a view of the Bay bridge, the ferrry building and the bay although the view was not really visible from the bed. The hotel is quite small - 8 floors and has an intimate feel, good service and a great bar area. The styling is sophicated and relaxed. The location is great with the market across the road and good bars and restaurants in the ferry building. We also stayed 2 nights at Union square later in our trip and by comparision, the location of Hotel Vitale was much better. The hotel is not cheap but highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “ONE THING could make it better...”
Reviews.Author: Silent Crow
Reviews.Content: Considering the luxury/value ratio, the Vitale is always my first choice in San Francisco; it is a wonderful boutique hotel, where the view is unparalleled. There's something about laying in that (VERY) comfortable bed, looking at the (VERY) romantic bridge, and it's nearly perfection. The staff is attentive. The hotel is spotlessly clean. The rooms are generous. The linens and appointments are all wonderful. The restaurant is terrific. Spa is lovely. The location simply could not be better. And the price is absolutely fair, compared to the expensive choices in San Francisco. The ONLY thing keeping them from a 5 rating is the lack of windows that open. Do properties not recognize what an impact private balconies have on their guests? I will stay in a lesser hotel with a balcony than the finest hotel in town. Thus... my only issue with the fantastic Vitale. They have super-easily accessible outdoor roof common areas, which NEARLY make up for it. But if I can't even open my own window to get some air in the night, or step out to test the temperature first-hand in the morning, well, you're not getting more than a "4" out of me. *sigh*

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, chill boutique hotel in a superb location.”
Reviews.Author: kweston
Reviews.Content: The ambiance is modern, streamlined/minimalist and tasteful. Spa-like. The rooms were well-styled and the bed lulled me to sleep each night. The staff was also very friendly and remembered me every morning and evening. The biggest plus was being so close to the Embarcadero. You could walk over in the morning and get the best cup of coffee from Blue Bottle and pick up an organic breakfast sandwich with farm to table eggs, cheese, mushrooms and greens. For lunch or a mid-day snack, there are a host of delicious options as well. There were several restaurants within walking distance for dinner. Ozumo sushi, across the street, was especially tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MexicoBride10
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Vitale for 2 nights during a trip to San Francisco. It was our first time in San Francisco and we had lots of "tourist-y" things planned. The Hotel Vitale was in a perfect location for all of our activities. We were close to the BART, Muni stops and landmarks like the Ferry Building. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms very spacious. The terrace is great for views of the city. The hotel bar was very happening on Saturday night when we arrived. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I'd make it my home!”
Reviews.Author: ccinchico
Reviews.Content: This has become our go to hotel when we go to a base ball game or desire to stay near the wharf or embarcadero. There is nothing that is missed by the staff and hotel. We have stayed numerous times. From the moment you drive up to the hotel til the moment you leave you are treated with respect from a kind and caring staff that is also always knowledgable. Sure parking comes with a fee but everywhere in the city does, so park your car and enjoy their town car service, the city's transit or as we do...just walk. Walk across the street and you can catch a rail. It's so centrally located to the wharf, embarcadero, a Giants game. The hotel is modernly decorated but very comfortable. You are treated to a warm cloth at check in and always a smile. The rooms range in size but are all comfortable with cozy linens and care around every corner with details. If you are seeking a quieter stay ask for an inside room. If you like the views of the city, request a room with a view of the clock tower and embarcadero. The hotel has provided a beautiful seating arrangement in the rooms that we have stayed in to enjoy these views! As a member of Joie de Vivre hotel's club (a free sign up) we always receive a bottle of wine at are room all chilled! Don't forget to sign up. The restaurant and bar is just as nice. The food is good and the drinks tasty! Its sitting area outside is great for relaxing and decompressing before heading up to your room. My favorite hotel for anything!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous chic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RLB_NYC
Reviews.Content: Five stars for the Hotel Vitale. We found a good rate and were so impressed with our standard room: it had an unbelievable view of the marina and a cozy window seat to curl up and stare... The rooms are impeccable and stylish. Very calm, serene and soothing. Great bathrooms. Fantastic location on the water. Don't miss the Ferry Building across the street which has an amazing market! I really liked the size of the hotel - smaller but still substantial. Having stayed in many of the larger hotels in San Francisco (Hyatt, the Mark Hopkins, etc.), I would chose the Hotel Vitale in a heartbeat the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Suites!”
Reviews.Author: vickyness
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Panoramic Suite for our wedding night. We hosted our reception at the Rincon Center and Hotel Vitale was just around the corner. The room was beautiful; luxurious and overlooked the Embarcadero and Ferry Building. There was a large soaking tub in the room and the bathrooms were large and spacious. The hotel is pricey but the staff is very accommodating and friendly. We ran into some issues and they worked around them to insure that we had a pleasant stay. Highly recommended! :)

Reviews.Title: “Really nice relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Pablo
Reviews.Content: A very relaxing place to stay - great rooms, nice bathrooms, great restaurant with a nice menu (but no buffet breakfast) really nice location near the Bay Bridge and waterfront. Would recommend for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: poipu67
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vitale is a great choice for San Francisco. Friendly staff with great service. Lively bar with friendly bartenders. The room was very nicely done and very quiet. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “fmarkus@pipeline.com”
Reviews.Author: FI_Flyer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Vitale several times and have been consistently satisfied. The location is fine. Although the Embarcadero is a bit out of the way, the nearby BART station and available taxis make the Vitale convenient from the airport or to the city. The ferry building with its market and restaurants is a big plus for me. (The nearby Occupy SF encampment is not a problem -- no noise, event though my room faced that way.) The rooms are comfortable. The beds, excellent with the down pillows and comforters that I prefer. First class bathrooms with showers that have decent water pressure. Good soft towels. The restaurant, called the Americano, seems to be very popular with the locals. I have used it for drinks with snacks and found it good, if, predictably, pricy. The breakfast was attractive but uninspired. Oh well. Good coffee though, which makes up for scrambled eggs that were a bit too hard for my taste. As I said earlier, i have been to the Vitale several times and will come again. Pricy, perhaps, but excellent rooms and service.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Lancellot
Reviews.Content: This is one of the finest hotels I have ever stayed in. The location, service and comfort of the room is second to none. When I return to SF, this will be my hotel of choice. I stayed in a waterfront room and highly recommend it. Book far in advance of the best deals!!

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting more from 'Joie de Vivre'”
Reviews.Author: Gotopinion
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a large group of friends & family in Hotel Vitale for a friends wedding in September 2011. While overall our experience was quite good, there were a few things that just didn't sit well with me. Firstly, we had arranged for the inhouse restaurant, Americano, to stay open the night of the wedding for a private party. We were promised by the manager that the bar would stay open til 1pm and that music would be played. Both of these promises were broken as the bar was closed before midnight, and there was never any music. We received nothing but grief from both the restaurant & hotels managers on duty, who did absolutely nothing to make the evening better. The result of this was 60 + wedding guests being rudely ejected from the restaurant and forced to find another location to continue to celebrate the wedding festivities. While the Joie de Vivre Group might manage Hotel Vitale, their was definitely NO 'Joie de Vivre' on my good friend's wedding night! p.s. If you are looking for upscale hookers, Hotel Vitale's happy hour is a great place to look.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: PeterPostLundsgaard
Reviews.Content: After trying a lot of different hotels I have found the place to stay when in SF. Hotel Vitale is greatly located, the rooms are super and the bar is great and everything is just right. This is for sure the best place to stay when in the Bay city.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spruce_51
Reviews.Content: Enjoy our stay at this hotel. I believe they advertise as a Zen feel and I would definitely agree. I don't know how large the hotel is, but it felt small and relaxing. Nice outdoor patios - You could get a cocktail downstairs, then take it with you to an upper floor outside patios. Great bath products - oversize towels - nice view - and they even asked us if we wanted a turn down service of water and chocolate. Yes!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachel Y
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the first leg of our honeymoon and it set a really high bar. As soon as we arrived the level of service was incredible, from the bellman at the door to the reception staff. Everyone was polite, friendly and super efficient. The room was lovely, large with an awesome view of the Bay Bridge. All the fittings and final touches made this hotel an absolute dream to stay in, quite possibly the best hotel I have ever stayed at. Very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “People watch for hours”
Reviews.Author: Holidayfixation
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and could not fault the place. The room was not overly large compared to others we had stayed however very modern and clean. The bathroom was of a good size with good water pressure. The window seat was great allowing hours of people watching. The concierge was very helpful as was the check in clerks however the doorman were a little rude. Only ate once in the restaurant for breakfast and the food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Nickwahwoo
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay for 8 days. This hotel is modern, clean and professionally run. The staff are all very helpful. It is in a great location. The cable cars and bus stops are at the side of the hotel (the MUNI passes are well worth purchasing). The Ferry Plaza is opposite with every type of food on offer. The ferry terminal is also opposite the hotel should you wish to go explore further. The hotel has outside terraces with comfortable chairs/sofa's for you to admire the view. Free Yoga classes are on offer every day. The Americano restaurant within the Hotel offers excellent food and service. The bar does get busy in the early part of the evening. The only down side is the park area next to the hotel is full of homeless people but you are not really aware of this from inside the hotel and does not cause you a problem. It is a totally smoke free environment. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical city hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: nickdodger
Reviews.Content: It isn't there there is anything wrong with this hotel. It is relatively new, well maintained and certainly well located within easy walking distance of the waterfront, it's right there, but also Chinatown and Union Square are walking distance away. While the staff were all well presented and professional I sensed the culture was all about money rather than service. Perhaps the trigger for this was that the in-room water was both chargeable and expensive and I may have projected from there. Overall a good stay and we would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: gurt29
Reviews.Content: I arrived into to San Francisco early Friday morning on labor weekend. I fully expected to just leave my bags in the hotel until I could check in later on & was pleasantly surprised to discover that they had a room ready at 10am so that certainly got my stay there off to a great start. The rooms are modern looking and nice decorated. However the location is probably one of it's biggest assets with easy access to the Ferry building and Farmer's market. The beds and shower robes were top quality. The turn-down service was also well appreciated. Any dealings that we had with the staff proved them to be a helpful and polite crew. All in all it was an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCatLady
Reviews.Content: San Francisco hotels are not inexpensive, so we took a lot of time to choose one. We were happy with the choice. At six years old, the Vitale is one of the newest S.F. hotels. On the Embarcadero, it is well located. Rooms are comfortable and nicely appointed. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Breakfast at the Americano was delicious, as was lunch. We were there twice over this trip with a break in between. Our second room #723, did get noice from upstairs (maybe they were setting up a meeting) in the morning, but was otherwise lovely! We will stay there again because in general, we slept well, ate well, and felt very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home in SF”
Reviews.Author: amanwarren
Reviews.Content: Another fine stay at the Hotel Vitale. Perfect location, eco-friendly rooms that are super comfortable, and a very attentive staff makes for a great stay -- short or lengthy. It's a personalized hotel experience that doesn't make it seem like there is one in every city. I always feel at home at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Vitale”
Reviews.Author: Anaps
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Vitale before heading to Sonoma and we booked this hotel based on a local friend's recommendation and were really pleased. We were able to check in early thanks to the ease of the front desk. The rooms are modern, clean and very comfortable. The linens and towels are very comfy and the hotel seems to really be trying to be forward about trying to be as green as possible. They do try to recycle and leave the blue bins in the room for guests to do so. They also have free wifi in the rooms which is a HUGE plus to us.The location is fantastic with beautiful views of the Bay Bridge from our room and the Ferry Building across the street. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family & when we we come back to SF we will definitely chose the Vitale.

Reviews.Title: “Bay Bridge View with Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: luluatoll
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vitale is modern and hip and is a great example of a well done Joie de Vivre hotel. The rooms are nice, average size, with modern appointments - if you can get one facing the water/Bay bridge, this is ideal. The hotel food is average â€“ and with San Francisco being a â€˜foodiesâ€™ town, there is no point in eating in your hotel with so many other options. The staff is sweet but not always entirely helpful. The hotelâ€™s location is the real draw - being across the street (the Embarcadero) from the Ferry Building (the culinary food hall) make it the perfect SF experience especially if you happen to be in the city Saturday, Thursday or Tuesday for the Farmers Market.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy location!.....”
Reviews.Author: Ucjeff64
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in an ideal spot.close to pier 39 fishermans wharf and giants ballpark.very seductive open rooms,with mirrored wall next to bed!only problem I had was the tremendous taxes and fees added to room/parking. Paid over $60 for parking and room taxes. Ouch!......once you get past that you surely will enjoy your stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a great to place to sta on the embarcardero”
Reviews.Author: Gustoguy
Reviews.Content: Have been travelling to SF for years and have stayed in most of the major hotels in center town, financial district and Fisherman's Wharf. All are OK, some sort of worn down, and all too expensive for what they provide. Thru an Expedia package i selected this hotel (based on TripAdvisor ratings) and was not disappointed. It is a very Zen hotel. Super clean, trendy and welcoming. The staff is as friendly as can be. Loved the spacious bathroom with huge marble walking shower (no bath) and spacious sink area. Bed was super comfy. Large flat screen and acool little sound generating machine at bedide (try the Chimes setting). A thermostat that actually works (!). The place passed the " no dust or grunge in the corners of the hallway carpets" with flying colors. Free coffee tea and lime flavoured water in the lobby. I had a beautiful view right onto the embarcardero from the 2nd floor. Noisy if you opened the window but real quiet with the window closed (a great sound proofing system). If you are really noise-sensitive then ask for a room facing away from the street. Neat outdoor lounge area on the 5th floor to sit and see the views. The gym is small so if you get there at rush hour the machines may be taken. I didnt eat in the restaurant but it was well attended and the food looked trendy and well presented. Easy walk everywhere as it sits right at the bottom of Mission St. Can't complain about anything and will make this my hotel of first choice when in SF!

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Nice”
Reviews.Author: pathunbeaten
Reviews.Content: Our favorite hotel in SF. Stylish rooms, perfect location. Splurge for one of the circular bay view rooms - tough to find a better place to wake up. Good restuarant. Attentive and courteous service. Beware of city view rooms that are closer to the street - they can be noisey. Can't wait for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: BeijingTrix
Reviews.Content: With only one night in San Francisco on transit, the Hotel Vitale was a great choice to relax and enjoy the city. From the friendly welcome and great service, to the spacious room and sweeping views out over the Bay, it was perfect for a first time brief visit. Really enjoyed sitting on the window seat with the Hotel Vitale CD playing and reading a book after a morning walk along the waterfront before a healthy breakfast in the downstairs restaurant. Hassle free check out...........a very relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, good facilities - felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lotus
Reviews.Content: This is undoubtedly the hotel I will always stay in when I'm in SF. I knew there was something special when they gave us hot towels as we checked in. The location is excellent. It's on the Embarcadero, with great views of the Bay Bridge. The Ferry Building is a couple of minutes' walk away, and there are ample eating/food/drink options there: Vietnamese, Italian, Seafood, Mexican, Wine, Groceries, Cheesemonger, etc. (including a biweekly farmers' market). It's also not far from the financial district, but it completely avoids the grunginess of Market/Mission Streets. The Embarcadero is also good for anyone who wants to run in the mornings (you can get to Fishermens' Wharf in about 10-15 minutes). The staff were excellent, and except for one unpleasant person at the front desk, we were greeted with smiles and helpful attentiveness all round. Our room was large and had a view of the Bay Bridge from the Mission St side. I would think that a room on the Embarcadero side might be noisy because of the traffic. That said, I don't know that for a fact - it's a guess. The room was clean, all fittings were fresh and modern, and I was happy with the size of the bathroom. Everything felt very new, although the last renovation took place in 2005, I was told. The restaurant - Americano - has a nice outdoor terrace. The food isn't anything special. Pretty average on a global scale, and because SF food standards are generally high, I'd say it was below average for SF standards. But you probably don't really need to eat there (unless you want breakfast before 9am), because you can get breakfast, lunch and dinner at the Ferry Building!

Reviews.Title: “It's never disappointed us”
Reviews.Author: cmachi
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Hotel Vitale, although the last two trips were almost 6 years ago. Having so much time pass, I must say that it there were a couple impressive things about the place. For starters, the building is still in really really nice shape - they are clean, modern, and comfortable. Same goes for our room - no signs of even a little wear and tear (which would have been expected), and our bathroom was spotless! The next thing I loved was the service - we had a bellhop who recognized us from our trip 6 years ago! It's those kinds of small little touches that make the Hotel Vitale special.

Reviews.Title: “It's our go-to San Fran hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vinyasagirl
Reviews.Content: location is amazing right across from the ferry bldg and the farmers mkt on Saturday. The rooms are small but clean and sleek. My one complaint last time we stayed was that we got one of the rooms with a big bath tub, and the bath was fantastic but the bed was small and not very comfy. For some reason you can't have a bath AND a big bed. Otherwise, though, friendly, helpful staff. Had room service for dinner one night and it was fantastic. The hotel does seem to attract a young hip crowd and lots of wedding folks, so the hallways can sometimes be a bit... Lively. Never has affected our sleep though. We've looked at all kinds of hotels in the city and always go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelingbarbie08
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a wedding and this was the recommended hotel. It was very nice and I have no complaints except it was a bit pricey. It is across the street from the Market. Beware that this hotel has inside rooms with no windows. Those are the cheapest rooms, which is what we reserved but a week or so before our arrival we were offered for an upgrade for $15. If you get that offer, take it.

Reviews.Title: “Service Galore”
Reviews.Author: bght
Reviews.Content: After our reservation, we were delighted to see that the Hotel Vitale sent us some very helpful emails. They ranged from great places to see, eat or shop. Keith was more than helpful in booking reservations when needed, and all prior to our vacation. Upon arrival the service began. There was always staff willing and able to accomodate whatever you needed. Our room was very clean, and spacious. The beds were very comfortable, and room was quiet at all times. We had a great view from our room as well. The TCHO chocolate everyday didn't hurt either. Yummy. The location was superb. We did alot of walking but didn't have to . The cable cars, trolley cars, buses, ferry etc all were within a stone throw away. Great location, quiet & clean room, great service and fabulous choc everyday. I felt like I was in heaven. Did I forget to mention the lovely robes in each room. You will not be disappointed with a stay at the Hotel Vitale in San Francisco. It is in the hub of action as well. Good job Hotel Vitale

Reviews.Title: “Wow. What a view”
Reviews.Author: JazzDK
Reviews.Content: Great location near ferry plaza...lots of food and shops. Easy transit options. View of bay bridge from our room is amazing. Worth it to get a sea view room!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, clean room, rates change daily”
Reviews.Author: SteveGGGG
Reviews.Content: This is a very god hotel, just a 5 min walk from the Ferry Building, that appears to cater to business clients a great deal. The room is clean, quiet and comfortable. The location is good and just a 5 min walk to the F15 electric trolley that runs by the Embarcadero (piers) which can take you to Fisherman's Wharf and the pier to Alcatraz. It's a 10 min walk from the California Cable car line. They offer free coffee and tea in the morning near the lobby. One thing you have to be aware of is that room rates can change on a daily basis. When the hotel is near capacity, the rates are significantly higher, so you have to continuously pursue lower rates with reservations or the Front Desk if you have already arrived. In these cases, the hotel is not a great value anymore. I think I prefer this location to Union Square because it's very crowded in that part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: VRinA2
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in Vitale and I would have rated it higher if windows were not sealed. I just don't understand why a hotel in SF would not let their guests open windows. I understand the scare of liability, but there are a million of ways to prevent people jumping out, falling, injuring themselves, etc., and letting fresh air, which abounds in San Francisco, in. Otherwise, I can just compliment the hotel and its attentive staff. Location is superb, in room amenities are great, and, did I already say it...location is superb. Will stay there again, if able to score such a good deal as last two times!

Reviews.Title: “Really Good”
Reviews.Author: tuesdayjones
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, really good service and lovely people to deal with. Our room wasn't enormous but it was very nice and extremely comfortable. Has a nice modern vibe without being cold or too trendy for school. Good location in that it was easy to walk across the road to the Ferry Building for breakfast. If you are in town to shop stay somewhere closer to Union Square but if you are a tourist or on business you cant go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay at - if you want to be in the financial district”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynBoy11215
Reviews.Content: First off...$48/night for parking. Yikes. Otherwise a ho hum experience. Didn't get a chance to check out the fitness center or the amenities besides breakfast (overpriced eggs, the usual), but the room was nice enough. Views are pretty spectatucular if you are looking out on the water, only problem is the huge advertisements across the street that illuminate at all hours of the night. For those on vacation that doesn't revolve around working, I would recommend staying somewhere more convenient to the rest of the city...either in Union Square, or my preference from my day long excursion in S.F., somewhere near Washington Square.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic waterfront location in Embarcadero.”
Reviews.Author: agpklp
Reviews.Content: Great small hotel with all the right touches. My 3 must haves in a hotel are location - check, great bed - check and great shower - check. All 3 were AAA+ The location can't be beat. Directly across from the Ferry Building with great views of the Bay Bridge. 2 roof top decks give you all the views you can imagine in Embarcadero. All the best restaurants are blocks away. In fact you can pretty much walk to anything from Chinatown to AT&T Park. Great rooms and great service. Of course you do have to pay for all this but to me it's worth it. Get a high floor room for best views and lower street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position”
Reviews.Author: saintf
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel in a wonderful position opposite the ferry building, with a perfect view of the harbour and the Oakland bridge. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was light and airy and had one of the most comfortable beds we've ever slept in. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service but one disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: ajlcdl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night recently - perfect location near Ferry building and staff were all great. Even had the maid cheerfully empty the minibar so my kids couldn't take anything and we could use for dinner leftovers. Since I'm an East-coaster, I like to get up for very early coffee. Although the coffee service starts at 6 am, the evening desk clerk told me to ask for coffee before that and they would get it for me. And it was true - I arrived to the lobby at 5 am, and received a great cup of coffee. However, I was the only one in the sitting area in the lobby, the music from the night before was still on, and was loud, and it hadn't been cleaned - there were dirty wine glasses and other debris scattered about. I asked the desk clerk if the music could be turned off and she told me there was no way, but then I asked the manager a little while later, and she turned it off. The hotel has an amazing cascading rooftop gardens but it was too cold to go out there. All in all great hotel, and great morning coffee, but not very relaxing place to drink it. I gave the value a "2" because it's very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre, Expensive, Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TPhinney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came for one night, July 16 2012. We don't get away much and were looking forward to it. We got there at 2:30 before check in. We got a room was on the second floor on the Bay side. If you wanted the curtains open to look out, everyone on the very busy street could also look in. We were hoping for a romantic feeling, but it felt like a fish bowl and exposed to the public. We asked if there was a different room. We were told there was only one other possible room on the third floor, and it would be ready about 4:00. The lady was not very gracious about it; the idea was it was a little inexplicable that we did not like the room. So we brought our stuff down to the lobby, went for a walk and came back at 4:00. The new 3rd floor room also faced the bay but because of the shape of the building was much farther back so was much more private feeling, although looking out over a dreary alley. The size and quality of the room was like a Holiday Inn with more "modern" style decorations. The bathroom in particular was disappointing, small with a little counter and a cheap-looking little bathtub. The bed was only OK. The location is nice of course, being right across from the Ferry Building. The price tag was $364.07, which suppposedly included one or more confusing "upgrades." This place was a big dissapointment. Expensive. They acted put out when we wanted to change rooms. When we left we were waiting for valet for about 20 minutes. Then we noticed our car was out front just sitting there but nobody told us. We left feeling pissed off.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great views!”
Reviews.Author: EmmaM32
Reviews.Content: When our shuttle first dropped us off at the hotel the first thing we noticed was the sparkley driveway. We both thought to ourselves, this must be a really nice hotel. And it sure was. This was our first time in San Francisco and we were visiting from Wisconsin. The occassion was for my partner's 30th birthday and so I really wanted the hotel to impress as the trip to SF was a birthday gift.We had a late arrival and the customer service desk employees were very friendly and got us checked in right away. We had a waterfront view room and when we first saw the view we were totally impressed. We had a great view of the Port of San Francisco, The Embarcadero and the Bay Bridge (which was all lit up because it was night when we arrived, which made it look even more impressive). The bed was very comfortable. We had several different pillows on the bed to choose from each with a different firmness. The shower is really modern and nice. I wish the room would have also had a bathtub. That is probably the only suggestion I have. We ordered room service twice and the food was good and the delivery prompt. We received great customer service throughout our entire stay. The SF Marathon was taking place Sunday 8/1 morning and the hotel had left us a letter apologizing for the noise level outside of our hotel room at 5:30am along with some ear plugs we could use. So that was nice they gave us a heads up. If ever we needed a cab we would just let the valet employees know and they would flag one down for us in flash. I highly recommend this hotel and would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel worthy of its name”
Reviews.Author: JHCWinchester
Reviews.Content: We love the location of Hotel Vitale across from the Ferry Building, with beautiful views of the bay and near some of our favorite restaurants. When I called to make a reservation for a visit with our daughter and son-in-law and to celebrate our fortieth wedding anniversary, the rooms with king beds and a tub (in addition to a shower) were already booked up in our price category. Stephanie in reservations was very helpful in explaining what was available and suggested that I opt for the eStandby Upgrade, which meant that if a room in a more premium category was available when we checked in, we could have it for the same price as the room we booked by prepaying a $15 fee, and the fee would be refunded if an upgrade was not available. At check-in, we were indeed upgraded to a luxurious, spacious room with a great layout and curved bank of windows overlooking the bay, remote controlled shades, and a wonderful soaking tub, uniquely designed to allow privacy and a view at the same time, in addition to the large rainfall style shower. Despite facing a busy street, our room was very quiet when the windows were closed and the bed was supremely comfortable. I didn't need a hot bath to fall asleep (but had one anyway with the bath salts that were replenished each day) because the sound machine provided on the bedside table did the trick. All these touches helped make our stay one of the nicest hotel experiences we've had. To top it all off, we found a bottle of wine and a delicious fruit and cheese plate awaiting us one evening with a lovely note wishing us a happy anniversary. Thank you Stephanie, and thank you Hotel Vitale -- we can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed - stayed at Vitale at least 6 times”
Reviews.Author: wilreynolds
Reviews.Content: So I travel to SF about 2 times a year for work, for the last 4 years and almost every tie I have stayed at Vitale. Joining their club was a great idea, as now I am getting upgrades from time to time and I must say the rooms with the large terraces are amazing! Location: First of all the location is great, but it is in the financial district a bit, so it can be a little quiet if you head towards the city. But being right on embarcadero makes it insanely easy to go to the stadium or the ferry building (which has a great farmers market on saturdays I believe). Hopping a ferry to sausalito is a breeze. Also if you are a walker, getting to coit tower or fishermans wharf isn't a bad walk at all. For you runners, running along embarcadero is awesome in the mornings. Its also close to the on ramp for 101/280, making is really easy to hop in the rental car and get out of the city for business meetings, you have to do no navigating of the downtown area. Staff: I think this is what makes me come back again and again too...the staff is amazing - great people who have always handled every issue I have ever had. They are great with helping me with things to do, but also with things like rental cars and what not, always having them on time and ready for me to get my day started. Style: The hotel has a vibe, its pretty hip, unti; my recent stay at Fasano in Rio, I thought this was one of the most hip hotels I've stayed in, and it is still way up there. Rooms: The rooms are well sized, the suites especially as they have a dining room table, and two sofas. The regular rooms are also great and great sized. If you get a room with a terrace, the room may be a bit smaller, but its worth it as the terraces are HUGE! Gym: Decent, definitely good enough to get a decent work out in.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected and I did expect real nice......”
Reviews.Author: jambony
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice shee sheeish hotel yet with traditional flair. Service was impeccable and the concierge saved me at least an hour in baseball/rush hour traffic by showing a clear alternate route on my map. location was perfect and we had a nice view of the Bay Bridge and piers.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, gorgeous room, great service”
Reviews.Author: jennreyy
Reviews.Content: We'd stay again for sure. For such an upscale hotel, the staff was very kind and accomodating. Loved the location and the room was beyond comfortable. We slept until 11:00 and haven't done that in YEARS considering we have a 3 year old and 2 year old child. Heaven! We used the Hotel Tonight iPhone app to book and got what I consider a great deal. $50 less than the Parc 55 Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “Get a room with a view”
Reviews.Author: SkyeTraveler
Reviews.Content: We originally booked an Urban Studio room, but after viewing it we immediately asked to change to a Waterfront room. The Urban Studio is a funky space, larger than normal, and with a soaking tub. But it looked out over a non-descript street. Being stuck with that view was so NOT why we came to San Francisco. In contrast, the Waterfront room looks out over the bay and has a wonderful view of the Bay Bridge. Much better! Even though the room only had a shower, and I thought wistfully of the soaking tub, it made for a more memorable stay. The hotel is well sited if you're a visitor. We're urban walkers, but even non-walkers should have little trouble getting to Fisherman's Wharf, Telegraph Hill, Nob Hill, Chinatown . . . all the bits you want in your holiday snaps. We had a very good dinner at a restaurant called Boulevard that's directly across the hotel on Mission Street. The hotel service was fine, but the only stand-out was the bell captain. She immediately saw that we were less than thrilled with our original room and suggested changing it. Then she contacted the front desk for us, and within two minutes it was done, with very little fuss. That's the kind of initiative you wish all hotel staff would take. When we needed a taxi, it sometimes took a while for the doorman to find one. So leave adequate time, or book one in advance, especially during busy periods. This is a chic, not-too-large hotel in a very good location. We would consider staying here again, but only in a room with a bay view.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for SFMarathon”
Reviews.Author: RioVistaMomma
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at 3 hotels on the Embarcadero by the start line of SF Marathon. This was the best yet. The room (we got a package deal for a delux king with view) had a view of the bay and the Ferry Building, it was roomy, bed was comfortable, had a small couch and chair as well as desk & chair. Fancy bathroom, great linens. We did not use the spa or fitness center. There is a restaurant in the hotel, wasn't impressed. No coffee in room - but did get a newspaper. The window was huge - enjoyed the view so much never turned on the TV.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: JLVitela
Reviews.Content: Booked a room because we found Hotel Vitale on tablethotels.com which is one of my favorite sites. When we arrived, we liked the aesthetic -- very hip hotel, good location and the bar on the lobby floor was really happening. However, the experience quickly did not meet my expectations. When we checked in they only had a king room available even though I had booked 2 queen beds. Only after 10 minutes discussing the issue did they agree to find a room with 2 beds -- which took more than an hour. Then when we got to the room, we found 2 full beds. When I called to ask why we weren't in a room with queen beds, the employee said, "Those are our queen beds." But they were *not* queen size. Later in the evening my friends and I had difficulty getting a cab back to the hotel from a local bar. After trying unsuccessfully to reach a cab company through the internet, I called the hotel and asked them to send a car. They said they didn't have a car to send and couldn't help me get a cab and then hung up on me. This is not the level of service I've come to expect from hotels on tablethotels.com. Overall I was very disappointed and wished I had booked a room somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful sense of design”
Reviews.Author: Steve A
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hotel Vitale. Being in the Hospitality Industry and having read Chip Conleyâ€™s book on motivation this was where I wanted to stay, while on a wine buying trip to California. The Bell Captain, Front Desk and Concierge were all very helpful and personable. The Concierge arranged for our rental car to be delivered to the hotel and had assembled an envelope of wine country maps and brochures. The hotel is well located, had a wonderful sense of design and from the 5th floor we had a great water and city view. The first morning my girlfriend arranged a surprise room service breakfast that was delightful. I was also pleased with the free internet. The 2nd night we had dinner reservations at Greens. When we ask for a taxi, the Captain said follows me and had the Hotelâ€™s private driver and Mercedes take us in style and at no cost other than a well deserved tip. The only thing that surprised me was the lack of coffeemakers in the room. The only negative was that in the planning stage of my trip I sent an email to both the General Manager and the Reservations Department with questions that were not answered.

Reviews.Title: “Go to san Fransico”
Reviews.Author: austin_TexasLkd
Reviews.Content: Love the Vitale, great stay, and great service, ask brian the conciegerge to help you. Ate at Tattiges, always fabulous.Ate at Wayfare tavern, a real treat

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Janice125
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a romantic weekend in SF to enjoy dining and art exhibits. Hotel Vitale was recommended by several friends and now we know why. The hotel is beautiful, the amenities are perfect and the location could not be better. The view from our room was of the bustling Ferry Building and the Bay Bridge! Just steps from the hotel we could enjoy fine dining, access to BART, great waterfront walking, etc. Staff was courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Full On SF Bay view”
Reviews.Author: Gretch3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a special rate for people who live in or near SF....available certain days and months, so very happy about that. The front desk gal was superb, very nice, professional and helped us find a quiet room that had a complete view of the Bay Bridge, Ferry Building, a wall of windows...traffic was very muffled. Luxurious bedding. There is a popular outdoor/indoor bar and restaurant, "Americana", great people watching and wine, food and drinks were excellent. Can't beat the location for SF if you want to be right close to the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great views!”
Reviews.Author: red0725
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the last two nights of our honeymoon. The hotel is a quick 30 minute ride from the airport (depending on what time you land) and very easy to find. The location is fabulous! Right across the street from the Ferry Building. When checking in, the front desk staff was extremely kind and friendly, even offering us hot towels for our face. The lobby is very simple and beautiul, and that theme flows into their rooms. We had a fabulous Delux Waterfront King room. It is worth the money! We had great views of the Bay Bride and the Ferry Building. It is also within walking distance to AT&T park (where we saw the Milwaukee Brewers beat the Giants! Go brew crew!). I'd say the only down fall is $50 to valet park every night. But, it is the city, and everything is expensive there, so not very suprising. Overall, a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal!”
Reviews.Author: LittlelilygirlNj
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our first stay in San Francisco, and got a great rate on Expedia traveling there in December. I have been brought up staying in nice hotels, but Hotel Vitale takes the cake! Everything was incredible and immaculate from the morning yoga to the nightly turn down service. This hotel pays attention to details; they even had a bit of lavender outside each door. As for the spa, my parents surprised us with a couples treatment, it was out of this world. If you have the cash or can get a great deal do yourself a favor and stay at hotel Vitale!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ADVann3
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is simply great! Get a waterfront room and stay on the 5th floor or higher. The bar/restaurant is loud and popular Weds-Fri...so keep that in mind if you like that or may not. The bed linens, towels, pillows, robes and toiletries are awesome, but the beds are hard ( hubby loved it - me not so much). The honor bar selection is great and so is their in room dining ( which is 24 hours). We'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite SF Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelsyWelsy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Vitale on three different occasions and each visit has been great. I have gone with just my husband, with my mom and daughter and also with my children. It doesn't matter. This hotel fits the bill. Very clean. Great location. Great staff. Our last visit, we had a room with a stunning view of the bay bridge. Beautiful! Since I have stayed at Hotel Vitale, I haven't stayed at another hotel in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: StopForDirections
Reviews.Content: I was here on business. I kept trying to remember the name to write the review and it always sort of slipped my mind. I think that's because my experience was neither remarkable or unremarkable, which is actually great. The room was nice and well appointed; location was great. Roof deck was a nice treat and was glad to be across the street from the Slanted Door and they bay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved Hotel Vitale”
Reviews.Author: MMMVB
Reviews.Content: The location of Hotel Vitale is perfect...close enough to walk almost anywhere but tucked away in a quieter area by the bay. Our room was a King Bay View and it was beautiful! Our view of the Bay Bridge was stunning & the room decor was gorgeous. The cleanest room I've ever been in & very comfortable bed. Also Quiet! The shower was huge & very cool... We enjoyed their restaurant for breakfast one night & drinks another. A great lounge with comfortable chairs & tables. Also enjoyed one of their roof top decks - great weather the entire time. Can't wait to return and will definitely stay at this hotel! Employees were wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: ahk45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Vitale when the other hotel we had booked was not up to par. This is a wonderful hotel with the most comfortable beds, Egyptian linens and soft comfy pillows. It was very quiet and in an excellent location on the Embarcadero. There are plenty of restaurants, the Ferry Terminal shops are right across the street and the area is very safe. It is not cheap but you get what you pay for. The only negative is that parking costs $48 per night. I would not hesitate to stay here again or recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: woodchucker
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I stayed here for three nights in June. We absolutely loved this hotel and the location was fabulous. Last time we were in San Francisco we stayed at the Argonaut on Fisherman's Wharf (great hotel, too!) but this time we wanted to avoid the Wharf and we weren't keen on staying in Union Square, either. Decided to try the Hotel Vitale and were so glad we did. We had a deluxe city view queen queen room, and it was without question one of the nicest rooms we have ever stayed in. Great price, too, somewhere around $175 a night. The room was absolutely beautiful, we were essentially in a corner room with windows on two sides- one of the sides looked onto a turf-covered terrace, connecting to another terrace on the next floor up which had lounge chairs and amazing views of the Ferry Building and the waterfront... we could see all the way to Alcatraz!
