Room had an iPod player, a nice TV, and a fantastic bathroom. The beds were outrageously comfortable. And the location! Our first night we could walk to the Giants game (about a mile down the Embarcadero--nice walk and seemed perfectly safe, lots of other people walking even on the way back to the hotel) and on Saturday morning we walked right across the street to the Ferry Building to the Farmer's Market and got breakfast there... I would not have missed this for the world, it was great fun. Walked to Union Square, to Chinatown, to North Beach, and very briefly to Fisherman's Wharf. Again, great location! We will definitely stay there again if we ever get to go back to San Francisco. The only complaint I could possibly lodge against the hotel is that I will say that the front desk staff were not overly friendly (though not positively unfriendly, just kind of cool). The valet staff were great, though. Overall, a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “A high quality hotel on the Embarcadero”
Reviews.Author: gglg
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Vitale is located on the corner of the Embarcadero and Mission Street on the edge of the business district. It is 3 or 4 km from the Fisherman's Wharf tourist precinct. We chose this hotel to avoid the tourist precinct. The hotel is elegant and modern. It has valet parking at a cost of A$48 a day-quite expensive but consistent with many city hotels around the world. Hotel staff were excellent. We chose a deluxe city view king room at a cost of A$467 per night inclusive of taxes. Breakfast is not included. The room was spacious and very comfortably appointed with high quality bathroom and fittings. The hotel has a restaurant but we chose to eat at nearby Perry's Restaurant/Bar at the Griffin Boutique hotel- a vibrant, friendly place with great atmosphere and food, happy hour nightly. There are many restaurants and cafes within walking distance and China Town etc a short taxi trip away. Enjoyed staying here very much and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: davidmad1
Reviews.Content: Short and sweet review for an awesome hotel. Stayed here for a romantic weekend get-away. All of the amenities are superior and the staff is very attentive and helpful. The location is perfect. Right across the street from many attractions including the Ferry building with lots of neat shops and restaurants. Of course the parking is expensive, but that's driven by the market.

Reviews.Title: “great location , some officious staff.”
Reviews.Author: cal021
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location and probably the only hotel in town not suffering the lack of taxis. I and my colleague found the rooms comfortable and quiet. the food in the restauants was excellent. the concierge was very helpful, but the staff did have a problem communicating with each other. we had invited 12 people to come for drinks; As there was no room in the bar, we checked with the bar manager and concierge that we could take them to the roof terrace. subsequently, a staff member came up to the roof, and asked us to leave as we constituted too large a group . we pointed out that we had checked in advance, and he retreated, but proper interstaff communication is preferable .

Reviews.Title: “Pass.”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningTraveler88
Reviews.Content: We had wanted to stay at Hotel Vitale for several years and just had not had the opportunity so we were very much looking forward to our stay. After a fantastic stay at the Four Seasons in Seattle, we had pretty high expectations for this next leg of our journey. My disappointment started from the moment we pulled up to unload our luggage. We were driving the classic "mommy" mini-van and had two kids in the back. There were three valet/bell staff in front engaged in conversation with one another that could not be bothered to open our doors or help with our luggage. After two requests from my friend that they assist (as I hauled the suitcases out of the minivan), we were finally helped. I had already unloaded all the bags. I asked if I "had to" check in if we were going sightseeing and they said that we needed to in order to leave the bags. I went to the front desk and gave our last name and they asked for my ID. I have a different last name from my husband and daughter (hardly uncommon these days I would think) and they told me that they could not check me in without my husband's "permission." Thankfully they agreed to hold our luggage without us checking in and luckily my husband's meetings started later than originally anticipated so he came by to "permit" us in. I am just glad that I did not have a child that needed to nap or a diaper that needed changing. When we returned later in the day after a long day of sightseeing, I had the same lukewarm experience with the bell staff. The hotel room was beautiful, we had a fantastic view of the bay, ferry building, bridge, etc. The bed was not the most comfortable and my husband had a backache both mornings (he had been at the Four Seasons and Westin previously that both have great beds). The bath products were not replaced after the first night despite the fact that we had used 100% of the conditioner among three people. Sleeping in the room proved difficult on Friday night with our room being above the outdoor terrace for "Americano." We stayed at the St. Regis in San Francisco and the Four Seasons in Palo Alto last year and are likely to go back to one of these other properties when we return to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Family Base for San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ExpeditionDaddy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel at least a dozen times solo for business however this was the first time I brought my family. After a long flight to San Francisco, relief doesn't quite cover the feeling we had pulling up to the Hotel Vitali, which turns out to be an outstanding family choice in the city. The hotel is perfectly located to keep kids busy as it is near the water for endless sightseeing, the Ferry Building for lots of interesting and new snacks, and all manner of public transportation including streetcars and cable cars. In particular, check out the family suites, which I think are one of the best bargains in the city. While there are larger rooms with huge balconies and much better views, for about $260 a night, you get a huge room with a dining table that seats 5, a pull out sofa, another couch, and a king bed. Try finding that anyplace else in San Francisco! Lest this sound like some Disney creation, the Vitali happens to be one of the most stylish hotels in the city with a great scene downstairs if mom and dad are looking for that. It was recently recommended by the New York Times as part of the weekly "36 hours in ______" series, and for good reason.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and service, a retreat from a long day”
Reviews.Author: philelmo68
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms, internet, bathrobes, slippers, big tv, chocolate and water, etc. Too many good things to list. They've really thought of everything. Newspaper, ipod dock, comfy bed and pillows, excellent location right by the ferry and F line. Away from the hustle and bustle of union square and the tenderloin area. Staff was great. I'm deducting one star because their business computers has a charge, free for 20 minutes, but min charge $1. Really you shouldn't be charging your guests for these little things. Great view from the terrace, go up at night. Didn't try the restaurant, but it is always loud and full of drunk people. Staff was very helpful. Great to retreat to a big and comfy room after a long day. A little pricey, but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, nice decor. We stay here often.”
Reviews.Author: fairfield744
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vitale is a wonderful boutique hotel wiith a great location if you have business in downtown SF or along the wharfs; are going to a Giants game; enjoy perusing the gourmet food stalls and tents at the Ferry Building markets; want to take the ferries or BART across the bay; or/and want to be within a reasonable hike or taxi ride to Union Square and Nordstrom Bloomingdale shopping or Moscone Center and SFMOMA. We also like it because it is is known to be a fairly 'hip' place to stay (A magazine modelling group and 'Zynga' were having meetings there when we visited last). Our main reasons for visiting SF is to go to offices in SF and to see our twenty-something children who live there so staying there insures they will come to see us and that we have a good location for entertaining clients. The kids like to stop by the hotel when they leave the office and then join us for a few cocktails downstairs atthe garden patio of the Bar Americano . Bar Americano offers an extremely lively and popular happy hour most weekdays. The Cafe Americano dining room also has a full menu thru the day and evening and the food is very good too. Other restaurants nearby include The Slanted Door, Boulevard, One Market, Boulette's Larder and many others. We have been guests many times at HV since they opened a number of years ago. When it was built the interior design was fresh and new and a little edgy. Now the interiors of the community rooms could use a spruce up but I suppose the recession has postponed some redecoration plans. The 'deluxe' hotel rooms are on the small side as they are in most city hotels, although they offer view rooms, suites and 'family' rooms if you need something more spacious. Be sure to check around for online discounts and packages as it is possible to get some pretty good rates. We like the hotel and are happy to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Foosh9
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have to say the Hotel Vitale is outstanding in almost every way. The location is great for easy walking distance to great restaurants, some shopping, the Ferry Building, The Embarcadero, AT&T Park, cable cars and all the great things that are accessible from the few hotels on the Embarcadero. Service is terrific, staff is great. Views are outstanding. Roof terraces great for a picnic, a cigar, a drink or just enjoying the SF Bay. If there is anything I would critique, it would be the small room size, the too low for most men showerhead, the too small for most adults shower and the toilet which felt about 6 inches off the floor. Also, very, very slow WiFi. With so many outstanding things, these are compromises that are acceptable but preclude me from giving the Vitale 5 stars. Would I come back, absolutely. A very enjoyable 5 night stay all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable straightforward hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kingmaker
Reviews.Content: The boutique tag is a bit of an overstatement. This is a modern and attractive hotel in a good location overlooking the bay. the room was exactly what you would expect from a modern business hotel - except I had a great view of the Bay bridge!

Reviews.Title: “All Around Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MdEst
Reviews.Content: Terrific location, good service, quiet room with all the amenities needed - overall great value. Definitely will stay there again next time in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, lovely spa feeling”
Reviews.Author: couple2go
Reviews.Content: You immediately experience a wonderful aroma in the lobby of Hotel Vitale. It smells like a fancy spa! It's a gentle herbal aroma. We were greeted immediately and warmly with smiles. The check in process was quick and painless. I worked with the concierge a few days in advance, Keith, to secure dinner and get Alcatraz info. He was very helpful and on top of things. We were very pleased with the cleanliness of the property, the size of the rooms and the helpfulness of the staff. Nice view from the room also. Our room was, I believe, 506. The location is perfection. Near transportation and the ferry station marketplace (love the cheese!). We could walk around and see a lot or hop on a train or bus within minutes. It's close to the Alcatraz pier (short ride or long walk) and not far from Fisherman's Wharf. Overall, very pleased with the hotel and will stay there again. The rooms are pricey but we were very happy with the excellent service and restaurant (only had breakfast at the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travelwiththeboys23
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with most of the reviews here... great spot! Great location, soundproof rooms, friendly staff. Though not sure it's typically a family hotel it was fine with our kids. Beautiful interiors and the roof top is great. Ferry Building directly across the street offers unique, local food and wines - at very high end prices. In the summer they offer an outdoor market on the wharf side of the building. Super easy access to the trams that will take you to Fisherman's Wharf and beyond. The only thing I would comment on was that our room had a strange, musky smell in it which continued in the hallway... smelled like a water leak somewhere may have become moldy. Since our son has severe asthma this was mildly worrisome. But otherwise, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Always good experience”
Reviews.Author: nasharch
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel several times on business trips and I always had a good experience. Whenever on business, I find two things very important:: Fast Internet service/WIFI and good sleep. Hotel Vitale can provide both of these 100%. The insulation is very good and I never heard other guests from the adjacent rooms, and the windows are of good quality too so that they really keep out the noise from the street. The restaurant/bar is a bit overpriced but the food is generally good. The staff is friendly and helpful and quick to respond to any request. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Great Property”
Reviews.Author: Ldiele
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity to stay at this property with college aged kids over thier spring break. We all loved its Comtemporary Style and Decor. Service and staff were exceptional. Happy we picked this location: walking distance to Ferry, Fishermans Wharf (1mile or so), North Beach and China Town.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service; nothing sacrificed here!”
Reviews.Author: TravisRy
Reviews.Content: I am in San Francisco a few times a year. This was my first stay at Vitale, and it was great. The warm towel to freshen up upon arrival was wonderful! I forgot my umbrella in the room, and the person at the front desk offered to have someone get it for me. I love that! I didn't eat at their restaurant, but had cocktails on both nights of my stay, and the place was hoppin'! I would absolutely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Our hotel in the city”
Reviews.Author: live0love0life
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love the Hotel Vitale. We have visited once or twice a year for the past few years. The staff is friendly and welcoming, and always at your service. We feel so taken care of! The best deal for us is the studio suite, because it is a smaller room but also has a giant soaking tub. Of course the large round suite is nice too, but we can't afford it every time! The restaurant serves organic food, which makes the hotel meet our needs completely! The farmer's market is across the street, so we could even do our shopping before heading home from a lovely weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality at a top notch hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Banpei
Reviews.Content: I came to San Francisco in February for a conference and stayed at the Vitale for 5 nights. The first time I visited SF I stayed at the Marc Hopkins, but I can definitely say that while both are excellent hotels, this one takes the top prize by far. Its location nearby the MUNI made it quite easy to take the tram down Market to the Moscone Center, and the view out my window of Treasure Island and the Bay Bridge was spectacular. The rooms were quite well appointed and up to date as well. The restaurant was also quite good, in particular the desserts. Mmmm....zeppole. Next time I come to SF I will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Business and Leisure all in one”
Reviews.Author: sparkeresq
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for business or leisure. I had a tax conference, so I flew on a Thursday night to SFO; took BART to Embarcadero stop; took the short walk to the Hotel; quick check in; then had a fantastic dinner at the hotel restaurant and a great night of rest and awoke to a sun shinning on the Bay Bridge - what a great view from our room. My husband and I had tasty breakfast at the hotel restaurant with my latte perfectly prepared; he went to work and I went to the conference. Friday night we had another great dinner across the street at the Ferry Building at the Slanted Door. Saturday and Sunday we got to have fun with friends all day while our room was perfected with nice towels hung up, nice soaps lining the shower, and clean, soft sheets, and big pillows to flop onto at night. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: vectorvictor
Reviews.Content: We would like to add our praise to the others for the Hotel Vitale. The room (city view) was large, well-appointed and clean (the city views don't add much to see, but they're probably better than the interior view rooms). The staff was just wonderful: always cheerful, helpful, and ready to assist us. Free internet and bottled water every night were a welcome addition when so many hotels charge for these. The location couldn't be better. It is only one block away from the Ferry Terminal (be sure to vist the Farmer's Market, especially on Saturdays), the F-Line streetcars are around the corner, taking you to Fisherman's Wharf. And the BART is only a couple of blocks away. We took the BART to and from the airport and walked to the hotel, and it was really nice not having the hassle and extra expense of a car. Finally, the price was reasonable for a big-city hotel. All-in-all, we highly recommend the Hotel Vitale.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in san francisco”
Reviews.Author: ladybugSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best accomodations in san francisco. We have stayed at all the 5 star hotels in the city and the Hotel Vitale is better in service, rooms and location, The veranda on the 7the floor overlooking the ferry building is amazing. The bar and food at the americano restaurant is top notch. Staff always goes to great lengths to make you comfortable and welcome.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star experience at much lower than expected price”
Reviews.Author: pasa2ps
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Vitale often when in San Francisco and they have always been consistently good, friendly and helpful. The location is terrific right by the waterfront and within walking distance to many great restaurants and activities. from a business perspective, the cafe Americano offers a great place to meet for drinks, dinner, or breakfast and have a pleasant meal with lovely surroundings. This is my #1 choice to stay while in SF!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay in SF!”
Reviews.Author: bashbar
Reviews.Content: We do not have a single complaint about our recent stay at the Vitale. It is perfectly located, the rooms are spacious and well appointed and the service is stellar. We also enjoyed dining at Americano, the restaurant housed in the hotel. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience for a special birthday”
Reviews.Author: Jem9966
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Vitale as a special San Francisco sleepover for the my daughter's birthday. The staff went above and beyond, decorating the room and making it a super special night. The hotel is beautiful, the staff warm and friendly and the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and superb location.”
Reviews.Author: Belinda017
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at Hotel Vitale January 13th -17th while attending a conference in San Francisco. Due to a flight delay, I arrived past midnight and was given a quick, friendly check in. I asked for an upgrade to a room with a view ( at a small additional charge)and was easily accomodated. The hotel is lovely and just the right size - large enough to have a spa, a good restaurant ,and services, small enough to provide personal service. On my second night (a Friday) I realized the noise from the bar downstairs would disturb my sleep.(The bar was lively and looked to be a very happening place!)Scot, at the front desk, was extremely helpful, offering me a choice of two other rooms for the same price. I ended up on the 7th floor with a fantastic view of the Bay Bridge. As a single, female traveler, I appreciated the courtesy and respect displayed by all staff at the hotel. I will return for a mini vacation with my husband soon. A wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Incredible end to an amazing honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: ChrisWoodhams
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the final leg of our honeymoon. I'll start off with our room, we had a water view on the Embarcadero, it was spotless and extremely comfortable. It was so nice to sit on the sofa in the window and people watch! The location of the hotel was perfect, a nice 20 minute walk up to Fisherman's Wharf, tram stop right outside, bus stop right outside and 10 minute walk to good restaurants and bars. The food in the hotel's restaurant (Americano) was really good, we ate breakfast there and had dinner once too. The staff throughout the hotel were very friendly and helpful. An example of this was the concierge, on one of the nights we wanted a nice restaurant with some good seafood. We asked the guy at the concierge a good recommendation and to make a reservation. Not only did he do that, but he arrange for us to have a pre starter prepared by the chef! We would most definitely recommend this hotel and stay again if we manage a stop in San Francisco again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - comfort with class”
Reviews.Author: majorcat721
Reviews.Content: Great location on the Embarcadero - I was pleased to find that this hotel provides a comfortable oasis from the city noises. If you have business in the financial district this hotel has a spa that stays open late and a great restaurant with all types of interesting dishes. The rooms feel like they consulted a Zen expert - very comfortable with a clean and pleasant style. I was on the third floor street side and never heard traffic the entire week I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service Topped the Trip”
Reviews.Author: JDCNECSCV
Reviews.Content: This was a work meeting / holiday party with spouses trip. The hotel is very modern and comfortable. The service is impeccable using your name, asking for additional service and giving directions or advice/guidance on places to see, eat and travel. The room was very clean, the amenities were just what we needed to work and to relax and the restaurant/bar/lounge - Americano had everything a traveler needs to be comfortable. I would highly recommend staying here for work or pleasure. Ask for a room with a view of the Bay Bridge. The view of the sunrise with the Bay Bride in the scene is awe inspiring. We dined at One Market which is very nice restaurant with excellent food and service - highly recommend. The best service came from Monique at the Bell Desk, who immediately greeted us, conversed with us, gave us places to go, highlighting directions on the map and followed up with a call to ensure we knew where to go. Thank you Monique. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Really made our stay memorable!”
Reviews.Author: calgaryjetgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the great pleasure of staying at the Hotel Vitale on two occasions for our honeymoon. We arrived in San Francisco and stayed 4 days, travelled to Monterey overnight and then spent a week at a rented house in Guernville before returning to Hotel Vitale for our last 4 days. Upon our first arrival we were greated by amazing front desk staff. The lobby is well appointed, very clean and welcoming. We loved everything about the room from the linens to the layout. The bar/restaurant is small and popular so get there early. We enjoyed one meal there during our stay but with so many great choices in San Francisco make sure you get out and explore as well. We kept some of our luggage at the hotel while we went north for the week and when we came back we were greated like old friends. The concierge staff really give their service a personal touch and are full of advice on dining, entertainment and transportation. Our second stay brought an upgraded room with an amazing view of the Bay Bridge. The hotel was bit busier so thus a bit louder on our second stay but as it was the day before American Thanksgiving not too surprising. You are steps from the Ferry Building which is its own amazing source of food so the location is simply terrific. Easy connections on transit right at your door step and then of course there is the spa! Well worth a visit and we will definitely stay at Hotel Vitale again and likely look at other Joie De Vivre hotels as well. All in all our stay with Hotel Vitale really made our honeymoon memorable.

Reviews.Title: “The Ideal Place To Stay In San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: DeluthRuth
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a perfect mini-vacation at Hotel Vitale. There is no better place to stay in San Francisco. The waterfront location is wonderful and interesting; the rooms are quiet, bright, extraordinarily comfortable and well-equipped; and the entire hotel staff is kind, professional, and warm. I also thoroughly enjoyed two meals at the in-house restaurant. Delicious!! This is where I will always choose to stay while visiting beautiful San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “This is an excellent hotel with high quality staff opposite the Ferry Terminal”
Reviews.Author: jolly999
Reviews.Content: Given the crowds that circulate around Union Square, and the increasing numbers of down and outs that are congregating in the city centre, The Vitale at the end of Mission is an excellent low profile choice. Despite having 200 rooms it feels very personal and staff are motivated. Clean, slick and not pretentious, it is my first choice when i stay in San Francisco. Two Michelin restaurants either side of it, Epic, an outstanding steak restaurant five minutes away with Prospect also nearby, food is not an issue. Give it a try. ive

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, well-located hotel in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: rlf_vancity
Reviews.Content: Our confirmation for our stay at the Vitale had the best, self-proclaimed description of the hotel. I simply could not state it better: "Hip and holistic, stylish yet accessible, the Hotel Vitale has been called the ideal hotel for the person who has outgrown the W but isn't ready for the formality of the Four Seasons." The Vitale is well-located across the street from the Ferry Building on the Embarcadero (fabulous eats!!). It is convenient to the financial district and close to great restaurants in SoMa. You only need to step outside onto the terrace or out the front door to get a fantastic and expansive view of San Francisco. It is just so refreshing to be able to easily access the Embarcadero for a run! The rooms are very comfortable, peaceful and well-sized. Even though we had the basic category of room, we had a sitting area and spacious washroom. The king bed was delightfully comfortable and the room was warmly decorated. The service was fantastic - room service is quick, the turn down service and housekeeping is impeccable and the front desk and concierge staff are helpful and friendly. The TCHO chocolates and bottled water at turn down are a nice touch, as are amenities like free wi-fi and complimentary coffee / tea in the lobby. Prices for the rooms are also very fair (we got a special on twitter). Room service is like any other hotel, pricy, but the food quality was very good and the service was extremely quick. One small complaint is that the walls are fairly thin - to our chagrin at 3am we were woken to house music playing loudly in the room beside us. However, unlike other hotels in San Francisco that tolerate partying (ahem, W), the staff at the Vitale quickly put an end to this person's nocturnal exploits and allow us to go back to the peacefulness of a comfortable sleep. Overall, great location, peaceful and comfortable hotel, good value. I'd recommend the Vitale for both business travelers needing to access the FiDi as well as adult tourists looking for a boutique-like, comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TallyFL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just completed a whirlwind tour of California (partially business and leisure). After reading reviews on trip advisor decided to stay at this wonderful hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location is ideal, right by public transportation and being right across from the Ferry Building is an added bonus. The rooms are very tastefully decorated and extremely comfortable (very calming and relaxing). We had an interior room with a partial view, but this made the room very quite and since not much daylight hours was spent in the room it didn't make much difference what we were looking at. When you wanted a view, a short walk down the hall to one of the several roof terraces supplied spectacular views. Must recommend walking to the Ferry Building for a light breakfast in the morning and especially hit the Farmers Market on Saturday morning. Did not try the restaurant, breakfast was very pricey. The lounge area sure seemed to be a hot spot every evening. I have never had a maid stop and ask if everything was okay. If I ever make it back to the Bay Area I would definitely stay at the Hotel Vitale.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: TravelgalCathy
Reviews.Content: Hopping after-work bar scene on the first floor, but quiet on the floors above. Room was very nice - no complaints. There are other nice hotels in the area, but this one is an excellent location if your business is close by. It's only 1.5 miles to Pier 39 from the hotel, so a 3-mile run on the scenic Embarcadero was in order, and there are many excellent restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. There's free wifi, a gym, and a business center. If you have a car, parking is around $50 per day, so be prepared!

Reviews.Title: “Romance at The Vitale!”
Reviews.Author: DogBeach90265
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay with Bobby at the hotel. He was great - professional with a nice (felt like he was watching out for me) vibe. The hotel is in a great location right near the water and only a short, nice walk (a couple of blocks) from the BART Embarcadero stop. Upon my arrival I was warmly greeted by the Doorman, Concierge and Front Desk staff. The concierge had just gotten a really fantastic-looking burger from one of the other guests (who had brought it for him from a nearby eatery). When I commented that it looked great (I was STARVING from my trip) he offered to share it with me! Never in all my travels have I had an experience like that - and that burger sure hit the spot after hours of traveling!!! The front desk clerk (Denise) was kind enough to show me the rooms which were available so that I could choose the one I liked best. I chose the Urban Studio and stayed in room 730. The room was GREAT, and the soaking tub looking out the window onto the city was awesome. The bed linens (San Francisco Linens) & bath products (from Fresh) were amazing too! So awesome, in fact, that I plan to buy both for my home. The bed & room felt so clean that I didn't even follow my usual rule of never touching bedspreads! A great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel to spend your Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Smiddlem
Reviews.Content: Reserved our hotel through Hotwire.com, and got a great rate. I've stayed at the Hotel Vitale previously and have always enjoyed the experience. This time we were surprised to get a corner room facing the Ferry Building and the Bay Bridge - what a treat! The rooms are super comfortable and modern. Love the bath products, flat screen TV (need HD though) and fridge in the room. Happy to see recycling bins! Only wish is that the hotel had free wi-fi. Location is perfect and within walking distance of waterfront restaurants, not to mention the Ferry Building for breakfast. Can't wait till our next stay in the City by the Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, with wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: BitsyM
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed every facet of our stay at this hotel. The service was in the above average to exceptional range from everyone to the valet, room service and restaurant staff. We loved the rooms decor and how clean everything was. We are planning a future trip with the kids in early 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: tobywasp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the start of our US trip. The rooms are comfortable, a good size,tastefully furnished and the bed was extremely comfortable.The hotel is in a great location on the edge of the financial district and on the Embarcadero and not too busy but with easy access to all areas in the city via cable car or streetcars if you don't want to walk. The food in the restaurant was excellent although fairly expensive but I guess that's. San Francisco prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChessAdvisor
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Vitale was very impressive. I had a room with a bay view and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The rooms are clean, modern and tastefully decorated. I thought that the beds were particularly comfortable. Location is superb; particularly so if you like to go running as you can get straight onto the embarcadero without having to navigate through the grid system and all the annoying cross streets that come with it! The free wifi is fantastic and highlights what a scam most hotels are running by charging for it. The bar downstairs is great and the food fine. Personally I struggle to find anything on the room service menu that I actually wanted but I'm not sure whether that was because I was in a strange mood or because the menu is weird... I also really appreciated the outside space on the various balconies. Waking before dawn due to jetlag meant that I was able to enjoy a number of spectacular sunrises sitting out on the terrace. Having previously stayed at the W and the Clift I would definitely select the hotel Vitale for future stays!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bay Views and Spa”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugA2
Reviews.Content: We selected the Hotel Vitale for the combination of bay views and an on site spa. Although a bit away from the central shopping district, its still an easy walking distance to Pier 39 and the tourist areas (without being in the heart of the madness). Can also walk to the AT&T Park, where we saw the Giants play. The San Fran Marathon happened while we where there (we didn't realize) so in the early am we could hear the sounds of the race, but we didn't mind. A couple of the floors have outdoor balconies-- so get a room on one of the floors with an outdoor balcony. It was rarely occupied so it was like we had it to ourself.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel - highly recommed it”
Reviews.Author: Dancambell2
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for 3 nights in early September 2010 following recommendations from a two different friends, and we absolutely loved it. It certainly lives up to it's rating - very curtious, friend and proffessional staff, rooms are big and well fitted out, beds are really comfortable. The whole place is a class act. In fact the pictures of the rooms on the website don't do them justice - they are far more plush than they appear. The building has a very calming, relaxed, cool feel which is obviously the intention from the great decor. Would definatley return again and would recommend to anyone thinking of staying here. The in-room CD's are worth buying too.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in SF -- by far!”
Reviews.Author: MisterKelly
Reviews.Content: I live in NYC, but work takes me to San Francisco about 4 times per year. I've stayed in just about every luxury hotel in the city, but for the past couple of years I've been staying exclusively at The Vitale. The water view rooms are exquisite; there's just nothing like waking up and peering out over the water. I've been upgraded several times to the Circular Suite and it is nothing short of breathtaking. The staff, especially the concierges, are very helpful, and the room service is delicious. Plus, the hotel is always spotless. If you stay over a Friday night, be sure to visit the farmer's market at the ferry building on Saturday morning. Couldn't recommend this hotel more highly."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice -- Hotel Vitale has it all”
Reviews.Author: Socalesq
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two-night stay at Hotel Vitale and have only good things to say. First of all, the location is right across from the Ferry Building and our ocean-view room had a lovely view of the Ferry clock tower, bay and Bay Bridge. The room was clean, peaceful and quiet, no street noise at all. It takes only a few minutes to walk to the Embarcadero Metro stop. Everyone working at the hotel who we came in contact with was very friendly and helpful. One thing that I highly recommend trying is the hotel's spa bath treatment under the stars (well, we didn't see stars as it was fogged in that night) -- candles surround the bath (which is totally screened by bamboo for privacy), rose petals are sprinkled around, and soft music plays while you soak in an infinity bath...the ultimate pampering experience!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in SF”
Reviews.Author: Ayeletb
Reviews.Content: So this hotel has the most amazing beds. If you want to get a great night's sleep, this is the place. The rooms are modern and up to date. The pillows are the best. Room service is also great. I also love the location, especially on Saturday's when you are right across from the Farmer's Market. I used to love Americano, the restaurant and bar downstairs but lately, it is just mobbed and the waitresses have been rather rude. If it's not crowded then it is a great experience. There is a delicious open tuna panini, which is fantastic. The only better one I've had was at the Four Seasons hotel in Budapest but don't get me started on how great that hotel is!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Recovering from Jet Lag!”
Reviews.Author: Marshall04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights after flying from London. It is a modern boutique hotel with very comfortable rooms and friendly and helpful staff. They did not blink when we arrived with rucksacks. It provided everything we wanted for a place to crash for a couple of nights. The food in the dining room was good and they were very happy for us to have a small amount not at a normal meal time. The bar area is humming in the evening but it didn't bother us at all. The location is excellent. Would recommend it and definitely stay again if we could.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, amazing, amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cazzi31
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short and sweet..! The best hotel I have ever stayed in. Service, rooms, location, food, everything outstanding, I cannot recommend this hotel enough! 5***** 20 out of 10 !!!! View of the bay bridge is breathtaking,

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a visit”
Reviews.Author: johnascroft
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a boutique hotel and so is designed to be a little bit quirky, hopefully in a way that matches the customer's quirks! I liked it. The only issue I found was that my iPhone only worked intermittently in the hotel. Not sure if this was an AT&T issue, an iPhone issue or a roaming problem. The concierge service is fantastic - really knowledgeable and helpful. Room is well-equipped, I was able to remove a splinter just using the sewing kit in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not take customers a bit for granted - its success may work against it”
Reviews.Author: AnnabelNewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days and it is in a great location by the water (the Bay Bridge, the Ferry Building) and the hotel is beautifully designed with great rooms and common areas. If not for the first night, I would have given it a much better review. Apparently their policy is to overbook their hotel. After a very long journey from Hawaii, we arrived at 11pm to be told that they had overbooked and they were moving us to the Hyatt Regency around the corner for one night. GREAT!! Admittedly, they did pay for that night and when we returned the next day they upgraded us to a suite. Parking an astronomical $45 per night!! REALLY!!?? Is this the most expensive parking in the world? Apparently common to the area though. Restaurant was nice, bar scene was hopping. I think they have a lot of conferences here so quite businessey (near the financial district so that figures).

Reviews.Title: “Seamless service”
Reviews.Author: Brooklynite11
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotel Vitale twice in the past few months, for business purposes. I find the staff to be friendly, knowledgeable and invested in their work at the hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean, have beautiful views with all the modern comforts and free wi-fi, which is always nice for a business traveler. I expected a bit of noise when I stayed on the 2nd floor during my second stay but was surprised, even though the bar was bustling, to find the room was quiet. I will stay here every time I travel to San Francisco for work!

Reviews.Title: “great location, charming decor, great front line service, other services should do better”
Reviews.Author: gglucas
Reviews.Content: stayed 4 days there with my 10 yr twins and wife. the hotel location is great, the decor and colour schemes are elegant and trendy. overall we had a very pleasant stay and thought the front line staff was superb, friendly and professional. shame that room service and car valetting are not to the same standards. otherwise the room was ok but its layout not perfect. for instance there is very little cupboard space.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect from beginning to end!”
Reviews.Author: icee
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate at this hotel on Hotwire, but after just one night here, I would definitely pay full price. The room was nice and large and comfortable and very clean. The service was impeccable. Every employee was friendly and helpful. The location to The Ferry Building is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Forget Fisherman's Wharf - You will want to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: the_traveler_knows
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a quiet hotel in the heart of San Francisco, but with a lot of class. This was it. Right across the street from the Market, Ocean Front, Wonderful terraces, and exceptional service. If you want to avoid the tourist traps, noise and hustle and bustle of the city then this spot is for you. Plus you are minutes by cab, or short walk to all the hot spots of the city. The rooms are excellent! All the little things that make a hotel stay fantastic you can find at this small "hip" hotel. Young or old they cater to all. The concierge was terrific. Found us a great spot for dinner â€œGeorgesâ€�. The desk and doorman staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel helped us have a truly perfect San Francisco weekend. Thank YOU! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great return stay. Fabulous Location!”
Reviews.Author: Capt-Canuck5
Reviews.Content: We quite enjoyed our second visit to the Vitale. Wonderful location across from the Ferry Building and walking distance to many great restaurants. Great customer service and we enjoyed the morning yoga as well. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Vinifico
Reviews.Content: I've been down to San Francisco on business quite a few times lately and this is the hotel I always try to book. It's got a trendy elegance to it and an unpretentious and relaxed atmosphere that makes it feel like home. The rooms are quite spacious and comfortable, the service is courteous and polished and the location is fantastic (across the street from the Ferry Building Marketplace). I love the place. Note: make sure to check out the deck(s) on the 5th floor, especially on a sunny day. It's a great spot to sit with a glass of wine.

Reviews.Title: “You Will Like It”
Reviews.Author: StatenIslandGabby
Reviews.Content: I know that some of the reviews were iffy about this hotel, but I really liked it. I am a pain to everyone when it comes to hotels (must be spotless and in a safe location). I thought the location of this hotel was great. You are right across the street from the ferry building and there are plenty of options in the building and are the streets nearby (Perry's-very good). The rooms are a little on the small side but definitely doable with husband and two teenagers. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. I had know problems with staff. They were very pleasant at check in and check out. I also must say that Monique who worked bell services was absolutely fantastic. She gave us so much information on things to do, great restaurants, directions and general advice about the area. We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of our pacific coast highway trip and Monique got us off to a good start. I hope that this hotel knows what an asset she is. Thank you Monique for all the help. Anyway after look at the hotels in the Union Square and Wharf area I know that i made the right decision when choosing this hotel. Having the farmers market across the street really made it even that much better. Great food choices at the market.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful hotel - cannot recommend it enough”
Reviews.Author: Dean82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Vitale on the final leg of our honeymoon, having been to Vegas and Maui. The first thing that struck us was the location - it was perfect. Bang opposite the Bay Bridge and Pier 1, right in the heart of the financial district and equidistant between the centre of the city and Fisherman's Wharf. We arrived at 6am on our flight so wanted to check in very early. When we got there we were offered an upgrade to a circular suite for $100 a night (having paid $100 a night for a deluxe room as part of our honeymoon offer) - so for just $200 (Â£133) we got an incredibly elegant suite with panoramic views of the harbour and bay bridge opposite, and got to check in eight hours early. The room was beautiful, equipped with 32" LCD, auto-blinds, two i-pod docks, great bathroom facilities and adequate wardrobe space. The rest of the hotel is very modern, with superb staff always on hand to help with taxis, info and transfers. There is a very nice bar/restaurant area where we drank only briefly but the staff were kind enough to treat us to two rounds of free drinks for the final nights of our honeymoon. We also came back on the first day to find a free bottle of Champagne on ice in our room courtesy of the hotel. It is also directly opposite the superb Boulevard restaurant (seperate review). I cannot recommend this place enough, no matter what reason you are staying in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience - computer stolen I believe”
Reviews.Author: quietbay
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner at this hotel for one night in a suite. When we arrived the check in staff was surly and seemed to be indifferent to our requests. They did provide an upgrade to a suite with a modest increase in price. Here is my problem: I left a computer in the room. A laptop. I haven't seen it since. I called and asked for help and was forwarded to a service manager's line. I talked with him and the hotel manager over the next few days but it was like pulling teeth to get them to look into the room, ask the staff and to take an interest generally. The manager just said their staff were trustworthy, with them for a long time, etc. Losing a computer is a very big deal! It is far more compromising than losing your wallet. Nevertheless the hotel management seemed to take a very indifferent approach. I haven't decided what to do next but I will at least start with this review. I believe this hotel's security is lax and their attention to this kind of the theft shows it.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, may be more of a buisness hotel”
Reviews.Author: confusedtraveller2
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for our honeymoon and overall had a great stay. I only marked it as 4 stars as it was quite buisness like. There are restaurants nearby but we found we had to walk the 20-30 min walk to fisher mans wharf to find something reasonable in price. expect to pay 35-40 dollars for the cheapest bottle of wine. We did splash out one night and it was good food saying that. I marked the sleep down too as the duffet and pillows were so airy and fluffy, but again this may be a personal issue. We found the location reasonable if you didn't mind a 20-30 min walk. There are so many ways to get around San Fran so public transport is never far away! I recommend the city segway tour, they are great fun and you get to see some of San Fran the tour bus doesn't go to! Bring a jumper its quite windy and there are loads of people in cheap SF fleece jackets because of this. There wasn't a huge amount of nightlife in San Fran where we were so that was slightly disappointing. Great trip very nice room, nice size and a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: Pincut
Reviews.Content: I did like Hotel Vitale. I didn't love it though. If it were a colour, it would be beige: inoffensive, reasonably calming, but just not that.... inspiring. I don't know. My room was nice. It could do with a lot more storage space; there is only one tiny wardrobe. The rooftop is nice. The bar was nice. The gym is pokey - much better to walk a couple of blocks to the YMCA where you can get a free pass. The staff were ok. I don't know. Like I said. Beige.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,but there's something missing that I just can't put my finger on.”
Reviews.Author: LavvyKing
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of July and enjoyed our stay in what is in our opinion more of a 'business' hotel. The service was of a good level although not exemplary,the room was a decent size for us all,although it is worth noting that if you book a family studio the view out of the mainly opaque window is facing inwards and onto various vents and machinery.As a result of the opaque window the room is very dark no matter what time of the day it is,although this was not an issue for ourselves,it may be for others. The only negative thing that we found about the room was that the bathroom looked like it had been kitted out by Super Mario with a shorter bath than normal and a fixed shower head that was way too low. As for the hotel's location next to the Ferry Building (which has loads of F & B outlets),there are all the transport links that you could ask for (Tram,Cable Car,Bus,BART,Hop on Hop off are all within yards of the hotel) and it's not hard to get to anywhere within the city quickly and efficiently There is a communal terrace that guests can use that looks onto the Ferry Building and this is a great people watching spot. We'd probably try a different hotel if we were in San Francisco again but wouldn't hesitate for it to be another of the Joie de Vivre chain.

Reviews.Title: “Room 716 is the best room in the city of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: HookAudio
Reviews.Content: Luxurious suite with 2 person bathtub. 6 cathedral windows overlooking embarcadero waterfront - the ferry building ot your left and bay bridge to your right. All amenities top notch. Great shower too. We rode ferry from Marin, spent day in North Beach, returned to bottle of champagne chilling in the room. partied. walked across the street to boulevard for dinner. partied. hit americano bar upon return. partied. hit the room. partied. amazing time. thank you...

Reviews.Title: “What you hear is not what you get...”
Reviews.Author: laj0llan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in several hotels on a recent trip to San Francisco. I was most looking forward to this hotel based on the reviews and also the price I doled out to stay here (~$250/night). Upon arrival I was greeted by the modern lobby, as previously mentioned. The location was great as it was close to BART and also the Embarcadero so my commute time to points of interest was short. When checking in, I had to wait 30 minutes for 'my room' while other couples/VIP's who checked in after me were whisked away to their room immediately. I dismissed this as bad luck since it happens to all of us at one point or another during travel. Unfortunately, that was just the first negative experience.... The room I ended up getting was facing the 'garden' which was basically the bottom level of an astro-turf courtyard. So, despite my wait, I got to settle for one of the interior facing rooms with nothing to see :/. The room ended up being very simple and plain. That's not necessarily bad, but for 250 bucks I expected a decent view and at the very least decent amenities within the room. Not so much... The bed was decent and there was good lighting. Unfortunately, the room had a bizarre desk/mini-fridge combo that was literally 1 ft away from the 19" wall mounted flat screen tv. While this may not seem bad, imagine trying to watch the game where you only have one seating option literally a foot away from the action. It was not ergonomic and it looked like they had designed the room with little thought to living there. The bathroom was well appointed (although it had little water pressure....3rd floor). They also had a nice set of terraces for people to sit on in order to enjoy the bay. In regards to customer service, this place did not project 'boutique hotel'. I ordered takeout (alot of great restaurants in the area) only to realize I didn't have any silverware. I called in to room service request silverware and a plate. It took 1 hour! After I saw my food going cold after 30 minutes I placed a follow up call and was rudely told that with +100 rooms that they couldn't tell me when I would receive my plate/fork. Unbelievable. To make matters worse, with a late flight out of SFO, I asked that they hold my luggage after checkout. I enjoyed the city during the day and came back and inquired if they could help me since I had to change before departure. The front desk would only offer me their bathroom in the lobby. I pleaded to use their spa/locker or even an empty room but they refused. So there I was in their lobby bathroom changing into a suit...Not exactly easy or hygienic. In closing, based on the price point, the poor room layout and the horrible service it leads me to believe this hotel is not worth it. I'm glad other patrons have had a positive experience so I'll leave you with this.... if you have to pay $250/night for a hotel room it should be a sure thing. In this case it wasn't ( I was there for 3 days) so it ended up being a waste.

Reviews.Title: “viggo loved it !”
Reviews.Author: viggo-hansen
Reviews.Content: if any hotel staff are reading this - this is a BIG thank you from Viggo, Madeleine and Alan who loved your hotel. The best hotel staff ever, we mean this. The bar is excellent (ask each bartender for his/her special), the breakfast folk are excellent with great humor, the reception is so friendly (not superficial), the bell boys and girls are damn cool. We loved you guys and we're not the type of folk to say that easily (ever, in fact). We spent 18 nights there (business/pleasure) and you made us feel completely at home. The hotel itself is very well situated, across the street from the farmer's market, ferries, a walk away from shopping, great restaurants (loved Mexico DF). Beds were great and rooms quite nice. When we return, we'll definitely stay with you again. Thank you so much, everyone!! Look out for Carl (very funny guy in the reastaurant), Eric, Jeremy, John, Ronaldo (the dangerous cocktail dudes), the lovely Columbian girl who brings you to your breakfast table, the sweet Chechan lady in the evening doing the same, the cool manager ladies and guy in the reastaurant who's name's i've forgotten, jacquie from reception and all the other great folk from reception who loved wee viggo, Brian the concierge and the lady concierge who helped us so much. You were BRILLIANT.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying at Vitale! I can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: ASYAmanda
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: Just off the embarcadero in front of the Ferry building. The location is the best part about this hotel! Views of the Bay Bridge, easy walking distance to activities and great restaurants! DURATION/TIME OF STAY/ PURPOSE: 3 days 2 nights over the 4th of July weekend. Vacation/ getaway and to spend time with family. AMBIANCE: Serine and minimalistic while still being up scale and elegant! HOTEL: The hotel itself is a small boutique hotel. There are 8 floors total. The lobby and hotel bar/restaurant is on the first floor. Second floor has offices and a very small workout room. Floors 3-7 are guest rooms and the 8th floor is the spa. On floors 5, to 8 there are outdoor rooftop spaces with gorgeous views of the city and bay! One of my favorite parts about staying at this hotel was enjoying the view of the Bay Bridge and sunny weather out on the rooftop! SERVICE: For the most part the service was great and the staff was friendly and helpful. The only minor issue was we didnâ€™t receive turndown service the first night and when we called for turndown they said they would send someone up and no one ever came. I also used the lobby restroom a couple of times and each time at least 1 of the sinks were clogged and it needed service. ROOM: We stayed in a Bay view room on the 4th floor. The room was modern, beautiful, clean and didnâ€™t feel cramped. The beds/linens are incredibly luxurious and comfortable and I got a great nightâ€™s sleep! I should warn you that there is limited closet/storage space both in the room and in the bathroom. There isnâ€™t any dresser and no drawers in the bathroom. This wasnâ€™t a problem for us but I can see if you were staying for a longer period of time that it could be an inconvenience. RESTAURANT/IN ROOM DINING: We didnâ€™t eat at the Americano restaurant but we did have drinks at the bar which was delightful! They also have some self serve coffee/tea in the lobby in the mornings. No coffee machines are in the room. SPA/GYM: Unfortunately I didnâ€™t have time to visit the spa this time around but I did visit the small gym on the 2nd floor and the YMCA gym across the street which you can get a day pass to as a guest at the Vitale. The small gym on the 2nd floor isnâ€™t much to look at as it was a small interior room without any windows. 1 treadmill, 1 elliptical, 1 recumbent bike and some free weights. The only reason I used this gym was the YMCA was closed on the 4th of July. It served its purpose but I would recommend going to the YMCA when available. PARKING: Valet parking only. $45/night. Although I suppose you could park your car on the street or in another non-hotel owned location. NOISE LEVEL: I will admit we did hear some knocking sounds from the persons in the room above us but never heard anyone talking and it wasnâ€™t so distracting that it disturbed our sleep. INTERNET:` Great they have two options for wired and wireless internet. The free internet is â€œslowerâ€� but perfect for checking e-mail etc. I just wonâ€™t try to download/upload anything to do streaming. For those of you wanting more bandwidth there is an upgraded version for a fee. SECURITY: I never felt unsafe staying at this hotel or in this location. Overall: It was delightful staying at Hotel Vitale and I canâ€™t wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: Angela837
Reviews.Content: The Vitale is a lovely boutique hotel. One thing I most LOVED is that every time I entered back into the hotel from the street was the peaceful feeling you immediately have - a combo of the tranquil colors used as well as the aromatherapy. The rooms are lovely and quite large for SF standards. Nice views of the Bay Bridge. The bar has really yummy chamomile tea. Staff is very friendly. I visit San Francisco often for business and have stayed at many hotels around the Embarcadero and Union Square areas - and the Vitale is definitely the nicest!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great views!”
Reviews.Author: cmason971
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at this hotel on our first trip to San Francisco in May 2009. We selected it because of its amazing location right on the edge of the Bay next to the Bay Bridge and all of the amazing landmarks in that area such as the Ferry Building. We stayed in a fantastic Waterfront room with an amazing view from our sitting area right next to the window. The room came with a great bathroom and we loved the contemporary decor. The hotel provided us with some great ambient music CDs to play when we were relaxing in our beautiful room. Having said all of that, there are a few caveats: If you are staying on the waterfront side of the hotel the street noise from the Embarcadero and the hotel's restaurant (which was really good, incidentally) can be a bit much. My husband and I are light sleepers and on vacation we like to nap before having a late dinner. We found this a bit difficult as the Embarcadero tends to be favoured by motorcyclists and people with loud car stereos at around the time that we normally napped. Also, the room we stayed in had a great shower but lacked a bathtub. You have to book an Urban Studio or one of the suites to get a bathtub. After an open-air tour around the bay and over to the ocean cost of San Fran we came back to the hotel chilled to the bone one day and it would have been really great to have a nice hot tub at that moment, but this is a common complaint I have with contemporary hotels, who think that providing a big rainshower-type shower is fine. Maybe for most travelers this is OK but I can't go more than a few days without craving a nice bath! Overall this hotel was great. The service was friendly and accommodating and the rooms were in my opinion really comfortable, nicely decorated and well appointed. For everything else, I would return to this hotel for the view and the location alone.

Reviews.Title: “Well designed, but starting to seem dated”
Reviews.Author: Greenlite711
Reviews.Content: This was the third Joie de Vivre hotel I stayed in, and while I haven't been impressed with the JdV chain, I was hoping the expensive room price would elevate the Hotel Vitale above the JdV standard. It did, a little bit, but not enough. The location is great, and the rooms are fine. However, the service was spotty, and little things gave away the hotel's "Joie de Vivre" affiliation; the dated food menu and crappy toiletries, for example. The staffing didn't seem to be up to snuff for a "luxury" hotel. I was traveling with a friend, and had paid extra to book 2 queen beds, but when I checked in we had only one king bed. The first woman I spoke with at the desk offered no solution besides a cot, and it was only after getting the manager involved and physically showing them my reservation confirmation on my lap top that they managed to get me a room with two beds (which the first woman had said was impossible). They didn't offer anything for the inconvenience, and barely apologized. You should know, if you are taking the BART, that the hotel is a little further from the station than you might expect - especially if you have heavy bags.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad points”
Reviews.Author: jelly4
Reviews.Content: Positives Very comfy beds Nice helpful concierge and reception staff Location was good Rooms and bathrooms were nice and the view from the room was great. Negatives We were given a room beside a terrace where people tended to hang out so we had to keep our curtains closed all the time. Lacked atmosphere - there was just some thing about the hotel that didn't do it for me. Very noisy - between doors banging and the cars going by outside it was hard to sleep. Quiet a few homeless people hanging around outside

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: hunna98
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel, location is fantastic and the rooms are funky and fun. Bar and restaurant are great. Staff is wonderful. Check out the roof deck... the view is wonderful at night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Vitale is the perfect "get away to the city" hotel.”
Reviews.Author: scfamily95062
Reviews.Content: The staff (from valet parking and front desk- to room service) were professional, knowledgeable and kind. The hotel was filled with room and rooftop water front views of the Embarcadero. The smell of fresh spa herbs filled the hallways and our modern room was gorgeously green and very clean. The room service was also excellent-great eggs bene. Wonderful trip! We would definitely stay at the Vitale again. Santa Cruz, CA.

Reviews.Title: “in place to be seen”
Reviews.Author: missymlincolnshire
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Friday tea time, sun shining and bar packed to the rafters. Hotel was spotless and perfectly located but did pay more than at any other previously visited US hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The Best place to stay in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: robinchristenson
Reviews.Content: Rare find to have an amazing rooftop patio!!! Amazing design and service, excellent restaurant and bar- Even loved the hair products....This is truly a gem-- I have stayed in several hotels and need a place that has the best location, design, and outdoor space (just in case the weather is actually nice!) You can't beat this boutique hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location for all attractions - excellent concierge Kevin”
Reviews.Author: Jaz3000
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and found a very smart and comfortable hotel. Complimentary water, local chocolate and next day weather chart with evening bed turndown. Service excellent and Kevin the concierge recommended a route on our trip to Napa Valley, including a hotel with a ittle known cafe to the side of the main restaurant with stunning views and fab lunch. Thanks. Very well placed hotel for Pier 39 - not too close but could walk or take tram. Hotel used a lot for business and the bar in the evening was noisy and full, but we were not disturbed in our room and were out sightseeing most of the time. Loved San Francisco and Vitale

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular views, service, and attentiont to detail!”
Reviews.Author: scsf33
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several hotels in San Francisco but this one stands apart from the rest. Its location allows for easy access to all the tourist destinations as well as a peaceful night of sleep. The rooms are impeccably decorated, with attention given to lighting, color, and cleanliness. The terrace offers privacy and amazing views of the Port and Farmer's Market. Breakfast out on the terrace makes for a wonderful start to the day! The staff is helpful and available.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of Choice”
Reviews.Author: csmears
Reviews.Content: Everytime i'm in SF, I try to stay at the Vitale. Great little hotel with a wonderful bar. Pros: Great rooms, clean and modern. Location is near the Ferry Building. Lots of great restaurants close by. Bar is a hot spot for happy hour. Good value Cons: Service is just OK. That being said, I've never really needed anything. The rooms and facilities are great.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and relaxing hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: VATraveler82
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in this hotel for a getaway in the first part of March. Hotel Vitale exceeded our expectations. It is a beautiful hotel and really gives you that "spa" feel. The small touches from lavender in the halls, great turn down service, lighting and room furnishing were just what we were looking for. The staff was great and very accomodating to help us with our late check out. We had massages in the spa which were out of this world relaxing. As two young women we felt very safe here and looked forward to returning to our hotel each night. The location was great across from the Ferry Building and it was wonderful to be able to easily cross the street for phenomenal coffee, sandwiches and gelato. It is also close to transportation. Also special thanks to the concierge (Jerry?) for helping me ship purchased wine home. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: LOLAMiami10
Reviews.Content: Visited San Francisco on March 12, 2010 with my husband, the trip was unforgettable, including our stay at Hotel Vitale. The check in staff was very kind and friendly. The Americano Restaurant has fantastic food and they even have happy hours. Great city location. Hotel Vitale is at walking distance to the Metro and bus stations. I needed directions to get to a specific place from the Hotel and was given immediate attention from their staff and they even provided me with a computer printout. The standard room was spacious and a beautiful view to the Bay Bridge. I really do recommend Hotel Vitale in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDIreland79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2009 for 4 nights....we'd just arrived in San Francisco for the first part of a holiday on the West Coast and the Vitale definitely got things off to a good start. We had a great view of the Bay Bridge from our room and the room itself was very comfortable, spacious and clean. The staff at reception and in the restaurant were friendly and helpful throughout and the concierge was extremely keen to help us out with any questions we had. In terms of location, the Vitale is just across from the Ferry Building and we had one of the best meals ever at the Slanted Door restaurant, which is at one corner of that building. It's a nice 10 minute walk from the hotel to Union Square; although the hotel is officially in the financial district, we found the location perfect for what was a holiday and not a business trip....in fact it's a good location (beside the water) in terms of discovering the many piers and getting to know the layout of the city. Overall, this is a great hotel (in a great city!) and i'd highly recommend it. The excellent service makes it all the better. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: kirsantacruz
Reviews.Content: I spent a lovely weekend at the Vitale for a girls getaway. We went to the Ferry Building across the street for the beautiful farmers market. Great view from our room. Next time I'll be back for a Giants game! Great location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Five star service in a friendly waterside hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shell4Andy
Reviews.Content: We are just about to check out of The Hotel Vitale before heading to Hawaii for the next leg of our Honeymoon and here is a lowdown of what we thought. The service here is excellent and by far some of the best service we have had in a hotel in the United States to date. Upon arriving we were given lovely scented hot towels to refresh ourselves and our room was not ready (but we knew check in was at 3pm) so went and grabbed some lunch on the Fisherman's Wharf over the road and headed back at 3pm. We had lunch at The Slanted Door which was delicious and took under 1 hour, the service was perfect but back to the hotel review! Our bags were already in our room so we made our way upstairs in the lift and arrived on the 7th floor. The hotel is modern yet cozy and doesn't have a clinical vibe to it like some modern style hotels do. It has a very green/eco/zen-like feel to it which is just what we like. The whole place smells of essential oils and the lighting is perfect. There was a crd in the room wishing us a Happy Honeymoon and later they bought up a bottle of Champagne which was really quite special of them and completely unexpected. The bed was superb. It has a selection of pillows on so if you like feather or foam you have a choice. The room was adequate sized and the bathroom was okay. The bath however was measly and one thing I did not like was the shower curtain. I never realised hotels still used these however it was quite modern and looked as though it was made of bamboo fabric. The toiletries are fab and the facial soap takes off mascara and I could use it on my face even though I wear contacts. Nothing was too perfumed or harsh unlike a lot of free toiletries you get in hotels. The shower was okay and powerful enough I guess. The location of this hotel is right on the end of the Embarcadero but likely you have a great farmers market opposite and some of the more glamourous outlets on this stretch of road. The further up you go towards the Pier 39 and Ghiradelli Square the more tacky it gets. I guess you are right in the Financial District here to it has quite a bit more class that other areas on the Embarcadero. The bar downstairs is nice and has a well healed crowd of suits most nights. Didn't eat here but I believe room service in the hotel comes from here. We did have breakfast room service one day which was expensive and not worth the money but I was ill and couldn't go out. They have a great selection of pay-per-view movies as I was ill we know they have a free DVD and DVD player service and my husband went downstairs to take to concierge. They said that they don't have many DVDs but if we wanted to pick a Pay per View movie they would take it off the bill for us. Those movies are $12.99 so it was a really kind gesture. We also ordered take away 2 nights and concierge helped us out with that too. They have a service called Waiters on Wheels that deliver from 100's of restaurants in the city. These are NOT affiliated with the hotel however and are an outside service. The hotels service was perfect. I would give it more stars if I could but it seems 5 is the limit. The thing I have to mark it down on is the bathroom which is very small and the bath tub is pathetic. I'm 5'3 and just about fit in it! Also the noise of some of the guests. Some obnoxious guests think it is okay to get out of the lift at 1am and have a conversation with their colleagues for 20 minutes on the landing. This echos down the hall and can be quite loud. Also the banging of the doors in the morning is a bit much as is the chatting in the halls of people with colleagues at 5-8am. Would it kill people to shut the doors quietly? The air conditioning was a little noisy when it kicks in but I think that is much the same in every hotel. I can understand that this is a business hotel mostly so I guess it's going to be a bit noisy like this. I wouldn't stay here again solely based on the noise levels of other guests and the trouble is there is no way the hotel can tell guests to shut the hell up when going up to their rooms and leaving them in the mornings which is a shame because Americans are SO LOUD and it's really inconsiderate towards other guests. My husband however sleeps like a log and didn't hear any of it. This hotel is perfect if you are an early riser say between 6-9:30am as this is when the guests start coming and going however if you like a lie in like me then I would chose something a little quieter. Please don't think the hotel is poor because I have gone on about the noise, this is something completely out of there control but my god it is without a doubt an idilic business hotel and a great hotel if you are going to get up at a sensible time for sightseeing. One other plus point is the hotel has EXCELLENT public transport links. There is a light rail/trolley stop/bus stop/lots of taxis in this area or within 3 mins walk. Perfect really! If you are staying in the hotel I really wouldn't waste your money on one of the bigger rooms. They are RIGHT by the lifts and if I think the noise was bad for me in room 720 these guys would have got it worse in the vista suites with the views of the harbour/bridge and the stand alone bathtubs. All in all this is a solid 4* hotel and I would recommend it for people who aren't lazy and don't want to stay in bed until gone 10:30am.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for a tired business traveler”
Reviews.Author: jooles_p
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Vitale. At check in, the staff was friendly and efficient. They set the tone for my stay. Although i came to San Francisco for a business trip, the hotel's location made it easy for me to meet up with college friends. I never sleep well on business trips but the cozy and comfortable bed made it easy for me to get much needed rest. The workspace and free internet service helped me to get work done quickly. Room service was tasty and arrived hot. My only wish is that i could have slept in and also enjoyed the yoga classes, fitness room and spa -- and spent a little more time checking out the neighborhood. But I'm hoping to return next month for a weekend with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Hot, horrible and hideous”
Reviews.Author: jimprnz19
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a decent location for downtown, but way away from any tourist attractions. The concierge service has no idea about the town and charge you for asking them questions. There are also hidden taxes and fees that the hotel will not explain but will gladly tack on to your bill upon check out. Don't call any part of the hotel other than the front desk from the in room phone or they will charge you. The rooms get hot at night and they only go down to 65. The walls are thin and the restaurant is loud. The only positive thing about the place is the spa and that is if you don't mind creepy people touching you. The rooms are over crowded with furniture and they don't have water or an ice machine. The minifridge is outrageously priced and dont dare take out their items and insert your own during your stay cause once the cleaning service has seen them you will be charged. The hotel also placed a hold on one of our credit cards and after 5 days still refuse to release the funds.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice!”
Reviews.Author: benjaminf
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here with my wife and our 5 month old baby over President's Day / Valentines Day weekend and couldn't have been more happy with our stay. We had a King room facing the Embarcadero / Bay / Ferry Building and the views out the windows were captivating. Especially being with our baby and not being able to get out and walk around the City as much as we used to it was very nice to be in the room and still feel part of the City by people watching out the windows and seeing the boats and barges come and go in the Bay. I had never really spent much time in this area of the City before but was impressed, much better than Union Square. We had nice walks along the Embarcadero, and ate great food from the market shop across the street at the Ferry Building. We ordered room service for some 'snacks' later in the evening and the service was prompt and food was fresh. Prices were reasonable from the restaurant downstairs and afterwards we wished we had ordered full dinner in. Every employee was very friendly and welcoming, everyone seemed to genuinely make us feel comfortable. And despite being a very busy weekend at the hotel we didn't run into any problems. We managed to have a very memorable weekend both romantic and fun (with our baby), we certainly want to go back for another stay. One tip if you are driving your own car would be to park in one of the public garages nearby, we paid $29 for a 24 hour period where the hotel valet services is $45.
